sequence: This was another great episode from season 11 of South Park . Cartman fakes having Tourette syndrome in order to  avoid following the strict instructions of his Grandma, who came for a surprise visit. However, his ruse quickly unravels when a neurologist and his gang find Cartman out and start chasing him around South Park. His wild ride comes to a crashing end when he learns to follow the instructions of his grandma, if only she stops adding red hot peppers to the recipe she just read off the internet. All in all, another fun-filled episode that reflects on what happens when kids test limits in unpredictable situations.

The Lone Ranger & Tonto set out to bring to justice a band of hooded raiders who have killed three Indians for what appears at first to be no apparent reason..that is until the Lone Ranger discovers from a conversation with the Indian Chief Tomache that each man possessed a medallion. The five medallions given by Tomache to his friends as gifts we later learn when combined will provide the mastermind behind the hooded raiders with a map to a legendary lost city of gold. Can the Lone Ranger protect the remaining two individuals in possession of the medallions before the hooded raiders get their hands on it?

This is the story of a guy who went up to see a comedy and it turned out to be  a night he’d never forget. When he walked in the venue, he was mesmerized. Not just by the crowd of happy, vibrant people that had filled the room, but also by the countless memorabilia from old TV shows, iconic pop culture and actors from the hey-day of classic comedies that lined the walls. Everyone in the room was there for the same purpose, to laugh and make each other feel good about themselves.

A good old-fashioned flight-and-revenge western , given a twist and a touch of gravitas by injecting a little black social  commentary and biker anthems

The new spin given to the movie added an intensity that would spark with interest in the classic old-fashioned western fan, and drew the eye of the masses. Characters ran away from the horrors of law enforcement with antihero escapades, leaping the sick and famished, fed and brewed by racism. Breaking boundaries and remixing racial judgements throughout the picture, you couldn't help but think that, underneath the bounty of catchy songs, bikeral piperies, and summerful photos.

After searching for 6 months, I finally found this DVD. All I can say is it was damn well worth the wait! "Rush in Rio" may very well be the greatest rock DVD in existence. I'm not joking. It's incredible! All the fuss about the sound being crappy is true, however it doesn't make the concert unwatchable. I find it makes you feel like you're actually in Rio watching the concert from the audience. That's one of the reasons I love this DVD. It makes you feel like you're actually there.

I shot this movie . I am very proud of the film . It was a great experience which shows 

It also showed how great a team we can be when working together and pushing to achieve something larger than ourselves. My pride was immense when we finally saw the finished product. With the help of professionals and others working in the film industry we have produced something really great. My desire to create something beautiful has finally been realized and now it’s my mission to continue producing films with original ideas and strong emotions.

I lack cable-vision and no longer have "DirecTV". So being a rural resident I have to wait for DVD releases. Being a lover of blondes but not blonds, I of course not only have "Barb Wire", but I have "Stripperella: The Complete First Season". I've not yet found "VIP" or a second season for Stripperella. I have the "Baywatch Hawaiian Wedding" DVD. I have the issues of "Playboy" that Pamela Denise Anderson posed in. I could go on. I love Pamela!

This is a `` revised '' Riverdance presentation , staged at Radio City Music hall in New York City . The acclaimed Irish dance show will include some changes in production , including a faster beat and changes to lighting and the song line up. However, classic Riverdance staples such as Irish tap dancing, colorful Irish costumes, mesmerizing precision moves and catchy traditional songs are all promised to keep audiences hooked. A step back in time as one of Ireland’s longest standing performance pieces shows Riverdance to continue in style and keep every performer captivating its audiences with beautiful music and Irish dance movements.

does anyone know where i could get my hands on this video or the film for this . I have  checked with my local video rental shops and video rental websites. I was not able to find the film or the video. I'm beginning to think that the film or the video might be out of circulation, or even not available for general public view. I've asked friends if anyone knows anything about this, or if anyone had copies of the film or video and nothing turned up so far. Perhaps if I had more leads or contacts it would help me.

First love . Teenage love . We all have experienced it even if it was not as sweet as the  fairy tales. Sometimes it seemed so wonderful, but sometimes it ended in heartbreaking loss and betrayal. But even then, the memory remains sweet, still causing the butterflies in the stomach. It does not really matter how it turned out. One thing for sure, it’s our most remarkable childhood memory. I often smile looking back in retrospect and feel relieved it didn’t take anything more than that back then. Experiences can lead us forward even when there’s some negative involved in it.

Gregory Peck and Gig Young are competing for the same girl and after Peck sends Young on a very dangerous  mission…

Young completes his mission, but feels he won't ever see the girl again. He continues to question whether or not she even reciprocates his affection, however she offers to find him after it is all done. As Peck had put Young in a tough position, he saw it was her kindness and love for him that broke Peck's resolve and for Young, his chance of happiness. Both Gregory Peck and Gig Young understand that no matter what, it is up to her.

`` Boy Next Door '' is a hilarious romp through male neurosis . In just over fifteen minutes , the  short offers an utterly insightful glimpse into how sometimes insecurity in relationships can both obscure as well as deepen connections between people . In many ways, this film embodies the sheer joy and sometimes awkward nature of new romance, finding fun in being seen in a way that other filmmakers rarely replicate. Rather than rushing straight towards traditional feelings and structure of a love story, the characters inhabit the nervous energy and bravado of the ever uncertain game of attraction.

This was a pretty good episode . Though no `` Trapped in the Closet '' or `` Cartoon Wars ,  '' South Park used serious issues 

South Park proved why it has been running for so many seasons by tackling a complicated social issue in a unique manner, just like they do best. Stan and the other characters offer creative insights into race and how much progress has actually been made by a supposedly liberal and tolerant nation. This episode dealt with difficult issues of intolerance and misinterpretations between the police and minorities and shed a powerful light on modern racism.

The make -or-break of a love story for me is whether or not I like the characters and also if they click with each other. Matt is pretty unlikeable: aloof, braggart, seemingly lazy, and a misogynist. He's been hurt badly by his dysfunctional mom and this makes him a little easier to take. I guess I liked the details of his dysfunction--he was believable. He overcompensates by bragging that he'l nail Amy. He acts so cool around Amy that he strikes out twice. When they do talk he can't show her who he really is.

This is a "revised" Riverdance presentation, staged at Radio City Music hall in New York City. Of the three Irish "dance" musicals that I watched during the mid to late '90s (which includes the first "Riverdance" and "Lord of the Dance") I liked this one the best.I thought it was better than the original, held in Dublin, Ireland, because it adds segments that are mostly good, it has a more varied and colorful stage setting and it eliminated apiece for two from that original that wasn't good to begin with.

A classic late 50's film. The superannuated headliners (Joan Crawford and Louis Jordan) are not at their best, but the direction, cinematography, and acting of the younger cast are compelling. In a 50's sense (which I love).The look and feel of the artsy (over-artsy?) contemporary film "Far from heaven" reflects exactly this sort of film (and I suspect this film may be one of the models). A silly plot, of course (hey, it's 1959! ), but as a film-- glorious!

Unlike some of the former commentators, I was (and am) an avid fan of the Carpenters. Face it, Christmas would never be Christmas without The Carpenters. That said, I believe the movie did a good, not excellent, job at depicting Karen's life. The movie was enjoyable to see on primetime TV, but the content fell a little short. I suggest that you all look into getting some of the Carpenters specials that were shown in the 70's. You cannot believe how awesome a drummer Karen was. Cynthia did not capture the extent of Karen's talent.

This is a film that is far more enjoyable than its rating of 7 would suggest. In many ways, it's like a 50s version of VALLEY OF THE DOLLS--with much of the excesses and sleaziness of VALLEY polished up a bit for the audiences of 1959. Like this later film, both are about three young ladies who are on the fast-track to success--though this time it's in the publishing world instead of the entertainment industry (though one of the ladies in THE BEST OF EVERYTHING does have aspirations of Broadway).The film begins with Hope Lange coming into the company for her first day of work.

This enjoyable Euro-western opens with a scene that predates a similar scene that Sergio Leone wanted to shoot for ``  The Good, The Bad, And The Ugly'', one of his classic masterpieces. Romo Lauro, the legendary man of honour rides into town to get the overdue supplies from Lully Stanridge. As Stanridge wonders how the small Romo managed to do this, the clanging of hoof beats answer him as both gangs pour into the narrow street. Tempers start to flare, violence erupting on the street, then falls still as if in judgement when a woman shouts `` Shoot him !

The year 1950 saw two very different and interesting westerns: 'The Gunfighter' by Henry King, and 'Wagon Master' by John Ford. 'The Gunfighter' was historically notable as it clearly influenced Zimmerman's 'High Noon' (1951) and later revisionist westerns.However, I personally find 'Wagon Master' superior to it's contemporary counterpart. Ford's minor masterpiece isn't much about storytelling; it should be conceived more as a poem describing conceptions of old west. Although optimistic and warm at heart, we are deserved from naivety because it's completely free from pretentious underscoring.

This is definitely an excellent show . I do n't have cable , so I started renting them , because 

I had heard so much good press and I was right! So far the episodes have had cliffhangers that have kept me wanting more. I just have to exercise my self-control to not binge watch them all at once. Thankfully I have had other activities and deadlines to keep me busy so I am doing just that. It is definitely a satisfying way to keep me preoccupied during these challenging times. Hopefully it can provide comfort and some distraction.

what was the quote by archbishop tutu at the end of the film about a person's past? this film was very disturbing to watch in the sense that it was a true story and to think that humanity is still so cruel after all these years makes me ashamed everyone is human and everyone has the right to live their life in peace and harmony live and let liveif anyone knows the quote please let me know Thank youthis film should be shown a lot more publicly as true events as horrific as these shown in the film should be known to all in the hope that things will change sooner rather than later.

Two horse traders arrive in a town and meet up with the leader of a group of Mormons who are  looking to buy. The traders proudly showed off their best stock and the Mormons saw their potential. After negotiating and finally agreeing to a price, the Mormons proudly set off with the new horses, impressed by the traders' performance. Everyone knew there were more business deals to be made and as the night progressed, more and more of the town's folks joined in to discuss different prices and evaluate more stock.

I finally received my DVD today, viewed it and I'm pleased to announce this is the original theatrical version of the film. As you may have read in previous reviews of "Rich and Famous" that the edited for TV version of the film that somehow made it onto VHS sometime in the late 90's but, now WB has corrected the error and released it on DVD complete with the airplane restroom scene, Matt Lattanzi's bare butt, and the scene in the Hotel room where Liz (Jacqueline Bisset) calls Merry (Candice Bergen) a C**t!

I thought this film was amazing and I laughed so much that I had to see it twice to catch  everything

I'm glad I went to see the movie twice because there was so much to it that I couldn't fit into my memory in one go. There were great characters and lots of witty dialogue. It also had some fantastic and unexpected plot twists which added a nice bit of unpredictability. Seeing it again gave me time to savour all the humour as I paused to take it all in and ponder the complex story-line. I'll definitely be checking out similar films by the same director.

I saw it in Europe-plex. Great movie!! This film is an exploration of the Spirit and the Flesh in modern times. Protagonist Jim Kirk, drives an unwieldy RV across America, stopping often to fill his gas-guzzling tank. He is middle-aged and confused . He fuels his thick, diabetic body with cups of coffee and radio chatter. He is the Flesh: agitated and sometimes spaced out, fairly oblivious to the growing tension around him but feeling it as twinges of discomfort. The Spirit suffuses the film through speeches and other sounds, as well as what appears and goes by in the visual field.

Watching The Wagonmaster is not likely to result in deep thoughts , unlike many other great Ford films , like  The Searchers and Stagecoach

However, The Wagonmaster, like Ford’s other Westerns, can be interpreted differently by viewers. Its characters and morals echo messages Ford had told previously through his stories. Perhaps the movie isn't trying to make a statement or strike fear but instead send a humble message to us all - there’s always a small but important spot for individual ideas and independent will amidst harsh injustice and unpractical measures.

In my opinion dads army is thee best British sitcom of all time . I believe that if you just  watch an episode, you're sure to feel absolutely entertained. One of the many unique features about this show is its cast, which includes all sorts of wonderful, goofy characters that bring a touch of humor to each episode. Whether it is the clueless and hapless Sgt. Mainwaring, the adventurous, kind-hearted and overly polite Pte. Godfrey, the eccentric Capt. Mainwaring, or the book-loving but helpless Pte. Jones, they all contribute in some way to making the show something truly special and delightful.

At first I could n't tell if it was an art film or a documentary . The day after I  looked at some of its awards, 

I decided that the film I watched had been nominated as a ‘Bester Art Documentary’ and realized it must be a combination of both. By using intense visuals and multiple view points from various characters in the movie, the filmmaker crafted a compelling film about modern culture and social activism. It presented a realistic perspective on life for a whole new generation, showcasing the day to day life in a compassionate manner.

I own the miniseries on DVD because I love this story so much . This is one of the best  shows I've seen in my life, as it has interesting characters, entertaining plots and dialogues that pull you in and keep you enthralled. I watch the miniseries often because it transports me to the world it portrays and lets me live through the experience along with the characters. This show helps me forget the troubles of life and fill it up with lots of exciting moments. Besides the episodes being excellent, it also offers deep insight into the depths of human experience which moves me a great deal.

This movie just might make you cooooo. The film was WELL worth the dark trip to town. Betty (Renee Zellweger)is the lone "acceptable" soap groupie out there. Her character is SO charming and SO convincing that you find yourself in forgiveness over her being such a goof. I might even allow myself to get lost in Bettys' adorable fantasy, if it weren't for the fact that Dr. Ravell's real name is George... And speak of the devil; "looker" Greg Kinnear fills his role VERY well.

Excellent entry in the RKO Saint series with well-written original script , good camera work and transitions , good directing 

RKO Saint has exceeded expectations in this offering, one that it would surely be difficult to match. The clever use of the location to enhance the storytelling really lifts this film, with exciting stunts. Scenes were timed very well with score blending in to continue momentum and continuity of emotions that carry the characters in the scene. Working together with the established cast and team at RKO to make it memorable on-screen action movie that pleases most.

Being an avid Carpenter Fan, I really loved this film (although the wigs do leave a lot to be desired!) and agree with many of the comments, that certain areas of her life were absent or not touched on. Whatever - it leaves your curiosity well and truly unsatisfied, so off I went to discover more. I must recommend a book by Ray Coleman - Carpenters - The Untold Story. The book is an intelligent read and unlike the film, is 'real' and down to earth. I hope you enjoy it. I remember Cynthia Gibb from her days in Fame and Gypsy.

I watched this movie for the first time around 1990 as a young kid and it scared the Jesus out  of me

At first I didn't quite understand what I was watching but I do remember that I had goosebumps watching this movie. I don't think I could get to sleep the whole night since I was too scared of the evil character.I tried not to close my eyes too often in fear that he might suddenly come out of the movie and haunt me in my dreams. From then, I wouldn’t even look at a single poster of this movie.

This film is remarkable in how unremarkable it is. This is the true story of one woman and one man and their quest for happiness amid the dull, rote life of a housewife and "man of the house". It could be any couple, any family, in any town... but that's what makes the story so moving. It touches each of us in some way and reminds us of someone we know and love, or of ourselves. I laughed, I cried, I couldn't stop thinking about it... and what more could you ask for from a film, really?

Sweeping drama with great sets, costumes and performances  though some folks are channeling Rhett, Scarlett, Melanie and even Lady Macbeth. Patrick Swayze and James Read are excellent as two men trying to maintain a friendship despite the ties of family and location. Splendid villains  you'll want them all to come to a very bad end. Lots of strong female characters in this one  both good and bad. Secondary story lines also are well developed. Several cameos by major stars of past eras. Good representation of history and conflicts for those caught between friendship and politics.

This movie used to be played constantly on the Disney Channel when I was a bit younger , and I  never wanted it to stop 

I would often feel like Cinderella every time the movie played, it made me so excited! My sister and I used to have Cinderella dress-up days and imagine being like her. As an adult, I look back and remember these precious moments with such fondness and have recommended the movie to all my nieces and nephews. My heart smiles when I hear them recite the characters’ dialogue, sign the song’s melody, and become enchanted by Cinderella and the delightful and heart-warming scenes!

This film had me spellbound this evening . Thanks to Fox Movie Classics for showing it uninterrupted . John Voight , in a fitting role , adeptly shifted between fable and drama without compromising one for another. I loved the fairytale elements intertwined into a contemporary script - a skill which movie makers rarely master. Of all his awards, he deserves the Academy award for a special performance. The soundtrack blended well into the cinematography -especially that scene where John climbs a hill to meet his new employer. This well made classic keeps its promises until the end.

I watched the first few moments on TCM a few years ago but stopped after about 15 minutes. I saw it listed on the schedule at the Stanford Theatre in Palo Alto, and I vowed I would make the 40 minute drive. The Stanford is an old fashioned movie house that starts each movie with the curtains still shut Yes, they have curtains. They opened as the Fox logo fanfare began to play. When "The Best of Everything" appeared in huge pink letters spread against the New York City skyline, I knew I was right for waiting.I lapped this movie up.

The most beautiful film . If one is looking for serious depth , meaning and excellent performance then you have  come to the right place. From first time actors to big time celebs, all have perfectly combined to make a mesmerizing yet evergreen piece of art. There's something surreal yet captivating in the performances and especially when the visuals and the intense yet moving score meld together it is an experience not to be forgotten easily. Whether one talks about costume designs, art direction, settings, cinematography, none can deny the marvelous creation that this film is.

I actually went to see this movie with low expectations since it was the only one that fit my schedule. And amazingly I found it really original. I have commented on other Colombian films before, and I agree that Colombian movies tend to have a similar scheme, and always try to make reference to the average vulgar people,especially trying to make jokes out of the continuous cursing. But let's face it, the language used in this film is not especially exaggerated. Unfortunately, this is how real people speak.

This epic brings together a superbly-gifted cast and crew, a narrative depth superior to most novels, wonderful music, philosophy and a connection to LIFE that I find difficult to explain. To immerse oneself in Die Zweite Heimat is for me akin to a spiritual experience, similar to the awe one gets when looking at the stars in a clear night sky. The language, and use of both colour and monochrome segments adds to the dramatic impact. The film inspired me to go to Munich and visit some of the locations, including the Edgar Reitz office.

Awww, I love this! The Tale of the Cat and the Moon doesn't really need an synopsis, as that's what it is... the cat chasing the moon, to a Spanish poem. It's the artistry that's interesting. In fact, there was this animated short called the Fan and the Flower that was an Academy Award winner last year (2005)... yeah, almost same thing, which leads me to believe it might just be a rip off.But this is a really good short, with stark black & white shapes shifting and transitioning into beautiful motion and poetic seduction...

Once again Elmer is faced with the dilemma of who to shoot . Bugs of Daffy . He 's unsure  about what decision to make. He contemplated their respective flaws, still unsure about whom to choose. Daffy has no knowledge or talent, whereas Bugs at least appears smart. Elmer is certain that Bugs can manipulate and would go out of his way to find a loophole for himself. However, Daffy is irritatingly comedic and always strives for attention. He wished he could go on a vacation, as it seemed his time off would help him decide.

Robin Hood; Men in Tights is worth watching, I recently watched it because I've just become a Cary Elwes fan, and this is one of of his lead-roles. Some moments really made me crack up so hard! I didn't expect them you know, it was so funny, Even the 2nd time around you'd still fall off your chair The cast is great, of course especially Robin of Locksley himself,Cary, but Blinkin and the Sheriff and Little John (Don't let the name fool you, it's veryy big!

I came across this movie in an Australian hotel room at 3 am. My brother and I were channel surfing and who do we see but a young Russel Crowe. But not the telephone throwing Russel Crowe we had come to know and quasi-love back in the states. This movie, much to my surprise, was amazingly creative and hilarious. It stars a cast of awkward teens with hilarious stories of odd sexual experiences, including a slick salesman,prostitutes, and an unusual sexy mother. If you are lucky enough to come across this film I would strongly suggest picking it up.

I was on my way out one morning when I was checking something on the T.V . and came across  a news story 

Suddenly, the headlines read that my hometown had been declared a warzone due to civil unrest. Panic surged through my veins as my heart raced with disbelief and fear. Reports from citizens gave chilling testimony to the magnitude of violence erupting through the streets. We heard firsthand accounts of unspeakable crimes, but the safety and well being of our friends and families weighed on our minds the most. All my friends were frantically searching for ways to reach home and desperately trying to connect with relatives living in the conflict-zone.

In Crystal City, a group of Mormons hire the horse traders Travis (Ben Johnson) and Sandy (Harry Carey Jr.) as wagon masters to lead their caravan to San Juan River. Along the journey, they meet first the broken wagon without water of the quack Dr. A. Locksley Hall (Alan Mowbray) and the prostitutes Denver (Joanne Dru) and Fleuretty Phyffe (Ruth Clifford). Then the sadistic outlaws Clegg boys decide to join the Mormon caravan to disguise the patrol leaded by the Sheriff of Crystal City that is chasing them.

The four signs on the road say `` If You 're Looking For Fun ..... You Do n't Need A  Gun '

The four signs were like a compass guiding the path to find out what 's fun without carrying a gun. Finding adventure that doesn't put oneself or others at risk can create deeper meaning in life and we all can choose the path that brings out our individual joy. Life's too short not to take that leap of faith, follow these four signs, trust in them and know there will be surprises ahead that won't need violence.

As I was reading through the comments , I was surprised to come across one that said this movie was  nothing but boring

After further investigation I found that this commenter had written this before actually watching the movie. It was based entirely off of other people's reviews, many of which expressed conflicting views. It seemed this particular comment was written before the person actually saw the movie themselves and had no intention of ever doing so. In my opinion, if one chooses to view a movie they should go in without pre-existing opinions. After all, opinions change!

If you repeat a lie enough number of times will it become the truth? 15 park avenue is the story of an alternative reality of a schizophrenic (Mithi). The movie is about her search for her home at a fictitious address where her imaginary husband and 5 children live. Aparna Sen delivers yet another masterpiece. Each and every actor of the movie was better than the other. Konkona Sen looks unbelievably convincing as a schizophrenic. She pulls off the role with such ease and maturity beyond her age. Shabana Azmi is incredible as usual.

I had the pleasure to view this film when I was 10 years old,(having an existing interest in Egyptology). I know that there are subtle mistakes to the art direction and costuming, but over all this is the best film, to date with the look of the 18th dynasty.The film only approximates Mika Walteri's "The Egyptian", in plot. A good portion of the text never made it to film, as we have to consider the running length.The music score by B. Hermann and Alfred Newman is beautiful!!! Performances as follows.

John Ford paid the wagons his tribute of a special picture , 'Wagon Master ' made after two big Indian-cavalry  Battles. The picture featured Indian War chief Jeff Chandler and explored how human empathy could overcome racial and cultural differences. 'Wagon Master' proved to be a successful movie for John Ford as it earned two awards at Cannes. His representation of strong Native American protagonists also contributed to altering preconceived stereotypes of Native Americans during the mid 1950s. Consequently, 'Wagon Master' inspired the newly-minted Indian Uprising Productions, the first all-Indian run movie production studio.

This film predates the Australian films Road Warrior and Priscilla of the Desert , and its influence on them is  profound. Mad Max came at a time where post-apocalyptic action movies were considered 'new'. It was at the forefront of Australia's maturing cinema scene and definitely deserved its success in introducing Australia's novel take on science-fiction. The film further explored post-apocalyptic themes which Priscilla and Road Warrior (1985) built on, paying tribute to a chaotic dystopian reality not familiar to Australians. It saw box office successes, especially internationally and paved the way for newer directors like George Miller to make their own entry into the sub-genre.

then you will be a big fan of this movie. Its almost the same basic concept, a nice mixture of music, soul, and drama. I'll admit, i was a little aprehensive about seeing this movie, I had only seen previews of a white trash girl chained to a radiator, but I am a big fan of Samuel L. Jackson and I enjoyed Hustle & Flow so i thought I would give it a chance.I'm very glad that I did. It turned out to be more than just the surface story of a nymphomaniac southern girl being imprisoned by a 60 year old black man.

It has been recorded that John Ford made the `` big , blockbuster '' movies so that he could afford 

John Ford was the first Hollywood director to utilize big budgets to make popular movies on a grand scale. From popular westerns such as Stagecoach, My Darling Clementine, The Searchers and The Man Who Shot Liberty Valance, to drama, comedy, biopic and musicals, Ford consistently drew a sizable and dedicated audience to the theatre. While others utilized wide angle vistas to depict a dynamic stage, Ford showed great knowledge and subtle techniques to accurately portray mood and emotion.

Fata Morgana is , by far , one of the weirdest and most perplexing art films I have ever seen  . The film is about a troubled couple that stays in an old abandoned palace during their honeymoon trip in Sicily. Things seem to become even more strange when one of them meets a ghostlike woman, whom they first believe is Fata Morgana - the one that appears in myths. Throughout the movie they stumble upon unexplained secrets, shadows, hallucinations and disembodied voices. All of it surrounds a culture that was built to show people's odd respect towards supernatural aspects of their culture.

The Box is one of the strangest movies I have ever seen. To explain my experience, let me use this word picture: Imagine that you have been binging on pixie sticks and paint fumes for the last month while watching nothing but Twilight Zone reruns. The resulting coma lands you in a hospital, where the nurse seems to get a kick out of shooting adrenalin into your IV. The dream that you have while in the coma will be something like this movie.SUMMARY: A man shows up at the door of a couple. He gives them a box with a button on it.

Brian (Wesley Eure) works for a security firm owned by Mr. Norton (Conrad Bain). The Norton firm is in financial trouble for, unknown to the owner, he has an employee who is selling secrets to a rival firm's owner (Jim Bacchus). It's not Brian, as he is a loyal and faithful employee and a good inventor. But, Mr. Norton has no patience with Brian, in part because Norton's beautiful daughter, Casey (Valerie Bertinelli) has a thing for Brian and Norton questions Brian's motives for wooing her.

This movie makes you think . It shows how a woman 's weaknesses can result in nightmares for others . The film highlights how social environments shape and influence the choices we make in life. It raises important questions about how female characters can be manipulated and exploited by people around them who recognize and abuse their vulnerability. It reflects the fear of feeling powerless and disregarded, despite knowing that something wrong is occurring. It inspires critical reflection on the dilemmas faced by a modern society increasingly shaped by powerful emotions like guilt, loss and regrets.

When this film gets it right it really gets it right . And when it goes wrong ... I 'd  rather not even discuss it! The same can be said of any movie though and with this particular film it seems that it really depends on the mood of the viewer and what part of the plot is playing out on screen. Some people found the latter half to be slower and, although the theme was powerful, perhaps lost some momentum and punch with some viewers. Other scenes had jarring, expository conversations and complex jump cuts that made it less of a pleasant cinematic experience.

First of all - I hardly ever watch Swedish movies, and this is actually the second time in my life I watch a Swedish movie on cinema! Therefor, I believe it's one of the best Swedish movies ever! The combination of thrill and humour is OUTSTANDING, and sometimes you don't even know if you should be terrified or just laugh! The plot is about this man, a writer who wants to go to Germany after World War II and help the Germans to start over. On the way to Germany, he is trying to help his friends on the train, which is however a bad idea.

This movie was so cool! I saw it on a Friday night with a couple of my friends. While the first credits were rolling, we saw that Lionsgate Films had made this movie. They are the ones that made that stupid movie Wolf Creek, which was totally gay! When we saw this, we groaned. We thought it was going to be like Wolf Creek, but we were so wrong! The movie was not only better than Wolf Creek (which really isn't that hard) it is one of the best horror movies I have seen in a long time!

`` L'Auberge Espagnole '' collected the audience wherever it was shown . It gathered audience awards on many film festivals  as it captured an unknown and indefinable atmosphere to millions. The warm critical reception made the movie and its message traveled further into the collective conscience and warmed up the hearts of many film goers. To this day, ''L'Auberge Espagnole '' continues to affect people around the world with its provocative exploration of themes, lifestyle choices and risk taking behaviour. People looking for relatable content for film viewers, who want to indulge themselves in stimulating issues and lighten their soul, turn to this cinema classic to this day for comfort.

I have not seen a better comedy than the King of Queens for many years . I rate it one  of the funniest sitcoms ever created. Since the series ended in 2007, there hasn't been another comedy quite like the King of Queens. Its clever writing and off-beat humour stand out to me as elements that make this series a must watch. The plots always evolve in such a clever manner, utilizing intelligent writing to help elevate the already entertaining and quirky story arcs. Many memorable characters, that help us gain further insight into Kevin's crazy household and job situations, aid in increasing the show's charm.

The trailer to this film focused so much on the chain ( of course , because it 's so sensational  ) but there's much more to the film than that. The rest of the film also highlights the dehumanizing practices at some of the prison facilities and paints a fuller picture of this scandal. There's also much criticism for for-profit prison institutions where private ownership leads to inadequate spending and regulations. All in all, it looks like this film dives into this hot issue from every angle possible, sparking conversations to facilitate some much-needed reform.

I didn't have very high expectations about Just Before Dawn. I don't know why I keep buying these slasher movies when I know it's all the same every time. Maybe I'm a bit masochistic? Anyway, I'm glad I bought this one. Yes, it's all the same. No, it has nothing original. Yes, it's about a little group of teenagers going in the woods to camp, drink and have sex. Yes, they get killed one by one by a maniac. And you know what? It's just magic!

when I first heard about this movie, I noticed it was one of the most controversial films of the 1970s. I noticed the music was by Elton John, so I figured I had nothing to loose, so I got it. What a Surprise!!! The movie was awesome. It was true love is all about. The characters (Paul and Michelle) had no luxuries, no money, and sometimes no food, yet they were still happy. I recommended this film to all my friends, but they all critized my tastes, and even called me names, becuase the movie featured two minors naked.

I have remembered this cartoon for over 50 years - what staying power it has! It was funny and creative; I wish my children and grandchildren could have seen it. It ranks right up there with Winky Dink - another favorite. I was pleased to find out that one of the creators later worked on Rocky and Bullwinkle. These early shows had a lot going for them that todays cartoons for kids don't have. Today's cartoons seem to push the idea that one needs something special, some magic formula or talent to be able to succeed against evil or dangerous circumstances.

One of the biggest French success of the year 2002, "l'auberge espagnole" was also very well greeted abroad which is quite extraordinary for a French film. It is not difficult to define the reasons of this success. This movie made by one of the most interesting French film-makers of these last years, Cédric Klapisch, presents students coming from all over Europe and gathered all together under the same roof in Barcelona. These students are described like the ones you imagine or you see in everyday life: either untidy, either serious or with a sense of humor.

Style over substance. But what a style it is. "The Cell" is the internal version of most serial killer movies. Unfortunately, the story hardly supports the visuals.Psychotherapist Catherine Deane (J-Lo) goes into her patients' dreams via artificial means to discover and help them over come their phobias and obsessions. A new patient whose fallen into a coma, is brought to her attention by the FBI. He's a serial killer who drowns his female victims then poses their bodies in grotesque scenarios like mannequins. Deane must enter the killer's mind and navigate through his sick fantasies in order to find and save his latest victim.

- A group of bandits rob a train of the gold shipment it is carrying. In their escape, the bandits split up. The one thief who knows where the gold is hidden is killed before he is able to talk. Three men have a different part of the "clue" that will lead to the gold. Can the banker, the bandit, and the bounty hunter work together to locate the missing loot? Or, will they kill each other first? - The plot is an obvious take-off of Leone's The Good, the Bad, and the Ugly.

A lot about USA The Movie can be summed up in its title . It draws parallels between the attitudes  and outlooks that power many facets of America's national character today and our own past. USA The Movie is more than just a nostalgia piece; it serves to remind viewers of the culture of self-governance, principles, courage and optimism that inspired early Americans. By being intentional with an increasingly fractured nation's dialogue, we can both remind others and educate ourselves of these values, often shrouded in murky and concealed judgement.

I couldn't believe the eye candy from start to finish. Being a fan of movies directed by music video masterminds. I am happy to report that the photography in this motion picture is a splendor for the eye to behold. There are so many rich, full images that are put before me, that each and every time that I see this movie, I find something new that I had not seen before. As with previous movies that I have seen, such as Blade and Mystery Men, also by former music video directors, the use of color to capture one's attention is utilized extremely well.

I just want to say that Chris Diamantopoulos's role as Williams for that entire show, was Emmy worthy. It was uncanny how well he did. And to be as rapid-fire and as random and as creative as Robin Williams really is....WOW. There were scenes where Diamantopoulos had to say probably 20 rapid fire lines and do 15 different characters while delivering those lines, all while sounds as much like ROBIN WILLIAMS doing those characters.....well, that my friends is impressive acting. Its one thing to do a Robin Williams impersonation for a couple of minutes.

This show is my absolute favorite. This show is intelligent, entertaining and always full of surprises. Lauren Graham is perfect as Lorelai Gilmore, a single mother who is Rory's best friend. Alexis Bledel shines as the beautiful and intelligent Rory Gilmore and Keiko Agena is one of a kind as Rory's best friend, Lane Kim. I love the witty dialog, it's what makes it unique about the show. Kelly Bishop is wicked great as Emily Gilmore and Edward Herrman is terrific as Richard Gilmore. Scott Patterson is a joy as Luke Danes and the band members are one of a kind to watch.

I would give this movie high marks for the cinema-photography and performances. I just read a user comment concerning the performance of the actress who plays a conniving courtesan who fleeces Sinuoeh, the lead character. I remember a mini-biography of this actress following the movie the last time I saw it. Apparently, she was a Holocaust refugee, discovered by a French husband and wife in the movie industry who were taken with her extraordinary beauty. She died very young and under tragic circumstances. Gene Tierney is also outstanding in this film.

I didn't personally know Karen Carpenter, nor, Richard for that matter, so I must go by how the movie portrayed her. I think a better person to ask about it's accuracy would be her brother Richard. However, from what I did see and learn of Karen, I felt her pain, share her sadness, and she was a very special person to me growing up. I know that I wasn't born until 1965 so I didn't get to know her as much as some of you older fans but I definitely grew up listening to her music and I have fond memories of her music.

This probably ranks in my Top-5 list of the funniest movies I've ever seen! I was not a big fan of Robin Hood, or Robin Hood: Prince of Thieves, but this movie was a lot different! It made fun of Robin Hood, and was HILARIOUS! I was extremely pleased with how well it was put together, and how well acted it was! Besides Home Alone, Mrs. Doubtfire, and Houseguest, this was the funniest move I've ever seen! I especially love the song; "We're Men in tights!"

The first time I saw `` Alice in Wonderland  an X-rated Musical Comedy '' , was in the early  90s. I was unsure at first but eager to know what the show was about. The reviews I'd read were impressive and it exceeded my expectations. The play was wild, imaginative and even had adults joining in the chorus.The musical was incredibly campy with fabulous choreography, laughter throughout the theater, catchy music and awesome special effects. The experience changed me for the better. It was unlike anything I had seen before and I learned to embrace what felt out of my comfort zone.

This 1959 soap opera film takes us into the lives and loves of three young women in the publishing world . Although life can sometimes be hectic and the odds against them, these three young women help one another grow and reach success. On their paths, they discover different life experiences that test the bond they have created over time, providing thoughtful exploration into life, love, and following one's heart. They venture into new careers, change partners, and struggle with rivalries. Above all, their unique relationship helps each of them realize their potential.

The Ma & Pa Kettle characters were highly popular AND controversial . The films that featured their brood paved the  way for TV families such as The Bradys, The Osbornes, The Simpsons, and the characters found on Stranger Things. In the 70 years since the Kettle movies were made, the legacy of the character has permeated our cultural awareness and their spirit is an endless source of humour. With more than 70-year's of existing and deepening rich comedic history, Ma & Pa Kettle has ensured their cultural spot as staples of physical comedy.

I've seen 'nurse betty' twice in september 2000 on the international film festival 'films by the sea' in vlissingen, the netherlands. It impressed me so much that I kept on smiling the whole day after I watched it for the first time and almost all evening again when I took the movie as the final taste of the festival. What I knew about 'nurse betty' was in short that renée zellweger would play a girl in love with a soap-opera-star. But what I saw was much more than that! Splendid roles for morgan freeman, chris rock ànd renée zellweger.

The most enjoyable pet movie since Scooby Doo and Garfield. The story revolves around a 23 year old inventor named Brian Foster whose systems at his boss's company seems to keep failing, Brian is also dating the boss's daughter named Casey. But Brian secretly invented a robotic dog named CHOMPS, modeled after his own dog Rascal. But CHOMPS is no ordinarily dog, he is as fast as a cheetah, he has x-ray vision, can leap about 6 feet, and has a strength of 20 men. The new invention impresses his boss, and makes his business a success.

Ignore the bad reviews on here , this film is awesome ! `` Just Before Dawn '' is a great  supernatural horror film set in a summer camp with a tragic story and one twist in the end that make you think twice.The film follows a group of six teenagers spending their holiday at the remote site in the rural forest with astonishing scenes of green nature that come to life in harmony with its horrific elements. The psychological pressure raises quickly as soon as the protagonists get isolated in their own solitude and as we’ll gradually see as things develop, and tensions start escalating between them, anything can be suspicious and mysterious.

I saw it in Europe-plex . Great movie ! ! This film is an exploration of the Spirit and the  search for meaning in life. The beautiful cinematography and imagery is supported by a sweeping musical score, that serves to evoke feelings of hope and resilience in its audience. The narrative carries with it an aura of tranquillity, grace and thoughtful contemplation that invites you to become part of the characters and their journey. As a viewer I felt genuinely moved and in awe at times. This experience has become the backbone to what my new definition of spirituality is and remains my one of my favorites films of all time.

I saw this movie when I was a lot younger but it captured me. I loved Orry and George's relationship so much. I was so enraptured in Orry and Madenline's love story. I am a hopeless romantic so it really got to me. I especially liked it when he first met her. I just wish he had more time with her and their baby. So you know in Book three I was so hurt that he died. I didn't really understand that because they had little time together. I just loved Patrick in this movie.

"Boy Next Door" is a hilarious romp through male neurosis. In just over fifteen minutes, the film takes us on a journey that most full-length features can't even match. Great performances, excellent camera work and editing---this short is a classic from start to finish. Kudos to Travis Davis for pulling double duty as both director and star. He's the funniest nebbish since Woody Allen. And what a treat to see Richard Moll back again. If you thought all he could do was play "Bull" the bailiff on "Night Court", think again.

I actually went to see this movie with low expectations since it was the only one that fit my schedule 

To my surprise, it was an incredible movie and far exceeded my expectations. It had plenty of intense action sequences, plenty of comedic moments, and great acting. There was never a dull moment and the cinematography was on point. This made for an engaging and enjoyable experience, it even had a surprising twist I did not anticipate. When the credits rolled, everyone around me was ecstatic about the movie and left the theater feeling very satisfied.

Thank you Mario Van Peebles for informing us of not only the existence of black cowboys , but providing a  window into their struggles

He reminded us that the physical abilities required for this work of discipline and labor had no prejudice when selecting recipients. We gained insight into a chapter of history often neglected by larger books in grade schools throughout America, making for a feeling of triumph over a sense of exclusion. Many remember Mario Van Peebles as the father in a revolution, offering invaluable information and creating awareness in regard to historical facts involving people of color.

Cant believe it.... after all these years finally tracked this down.. it was meant to be named 'The Great Pretender' at production stage. I was living in Oz at time and through a friend was looking after one of the house locations through filming.... It was me that showed these guys how to speak Scottish and after all this time, I only realise now one was Russell Crowe !!! It has taken me all these years to track this down, was even unsure if it ever went to screen as I left Oz the following month after wrap up party.

In Crystal City , a group of Mormons hire the horse traders Travis ( Ben Johnson ) and Sandy (  Harry Dean Stanton )

The two men team up for their travels and stumble across the ravages of nature as well as wild natives as they get further and further into this primitive unknown land. The chance for adventure helps drive them on as does the job to help rebuild Crystal City and unite it with Salt Lake City and with this mission Travis and Sandy drive harder and battle harder against the waves of risks that come with venturing deep into wilderness.

First of all - I 'm not one to go all sappy over movies . I saw Friends in the  park and had some fun. After watching it I really enjoyed the comedic take it had on different situations throughout the film. The witty script and endearing cast was remarkable and it actually left me with a great impression overall. It was a story that tugged on all kinds of emotion, mainly leaving me with this feeling of optimism. Although the romantic moments and wholesome vibes all blended together seamlessly it had a tongue-in-cheek sense of humor which I thought was brilliantly clever.

John Ford paid the wagons his tribute of a special picture, 'Wagon Master' made after two big Indian-cavalry epics... It is a lovely poetic movie, full of romanticized reincarnation of the pioneer spirit... It didn't have to top the big ones that had preceded it...Photographically, it is extremely simple... The camera moves only once or twice in the entire film, and never when a director would have made it move to underline a shot... Ford even resists the temptation to track his camera in the breathtaking twilight shots of the women wearily marching along in the dust behind their wagons...

This was the second Cinemascope spectacle that Fox produced after the Robe. Notice how some of the Roman sets are redressed to pass for Egyptian sets. The film is produced with all first class elements, beautiful photography, stirring soundtrack (Alfred Newman and Bernard Herrmann - see if you can tell which composer scored specific scenes). However, the principal acting is a bit weak. Edmund Purdom seems to have a limited range of emotions and is uninteresting to watch. The best performances come from Peter Ustinov as the one-eyed slave and Polish actress Bella Darvi as the Babylonian temptress "Nefer".

This was the second Cinemascope spectacle that Fox produced after the Robe . Notice how some of the Roman sets  were reused as an ancient Persian architecture? In King of Kings, Fox maximized their Cinemascope potential by shooting extravagant scenes of parades, executions, and demonstrations. Although this narrative brings us through various spectacles of Biblical Biblical plots and history, we feel just as enamoured when we get glimpses of stunning epic location shots. To accommodate this scale and imagery, director Nicholas Ray’s budget spiraled to the tens of millions; luckily the marvels of Cinemascope drew more people in during a highly competitive entertainment age.

Me and my roommate got free tickets for a Pre Screening I guess you would call it in Atlanta, GA at Atlantic Station. Walking in I was expecting something controversial, provocative, unnecessarily overdone, etc.. But the film is much more than that. It's a story of two people helping each other. It's not overdone, and the film is done in a careful balance as to not make you cringe or say its unnecessary.It's put together really well and doesn't take itself too seriously. Thats the beauty of it.

I did n't have very high expectations about Just Before Dawn . I do n't know why I keep buying  tickets

However, when I saw it, I was incredibly impressed with the way they used limited settings and filmed a naturalistic horror. They successfully portrayed the complex dynamics between people in claustrophobic situations, keeping me glued to my seat until the ending credits rolled.The soundtracks added great intensity to the creepy and chilling environment that the main characters encountered. The clever storytelling combined with impeccable visuals gave me an unforgettable cinema experience. It exceeded my expectations and for sure, it will be one of my favorite horror movies of all time.

A train holding union soldiers is transporting $300,000 of gold, along with a banker Clayton, who's there to see it reaches its destination, but it's suddenly robbed by the bandit Monetero. However Bahunda nicks off with the gold and hides it, but when Monetero tries to get it out of him, he's killed by soldiers. The only clue is that of a medallion, but Monetero is captured and soon would be executed. A stranger dressed up as a priest comes by (who after the bounty of Monetero) and offers to save his life for half of the gold.

An Intelligent and well obtained film worth to export! In this exiting and really intelligent movie filmed entirely in Bogotá, you can feel the total meaning of the word "Bluff"(although is a Colombian film, the title is in presented in English); ! The story is about Nicolas Andrade (Federico Lorusso), a photographer who find his girlfriend Margarita (Catalina Aristizabal) having an affair with his boss Pablo Mallarino (Victor Mallarino), owner of a magazine; after this Nicolas is left without girlfriend and without any job.

Every time I watch this show I just want to turn it off and curse the makers for wasting my time week after week. The dialogs, or monologues rather, as everybody just rants on endlessly about nothing, are just becoming so tedious. For example, the episode I watched yesterday began with a seemingly unending rambling about how a particular dish (I forgot what it was, pasta with meatballs perhaps) always manages to turn the Gilmore family dinner into all-out war. And these were just the few seconds or so.So it seems every time, lots of lines, with absolutely zero content.

Not knowing a great deal about the Truth and Reconciliation commission , I can only look at this as a  set of formal dialogues between victim and perpetrator.It will aim to investigate, educate, remember and help both parties reconcile with the difficult past that is still pervasive today. This can be done through restorative and symbolic methods such as helping with reparation, facilitating communal gatherings and restoring collective spaces. It is a way of reckoning with a history of hurt and deep emotional scarring. Every step taken is a step towards achieving not only emotional healing but the important goal of bringing people closer together.

I'm absolutely disgusted this movie isn't being sold. All who love this movie should email Disney and increase the demand for it. They'd eventually have to sell it then. I'd buy copies for everybody I know. Everything and everybody in this movie did a good job, and I haven't figured out why Disney hasn't put this movie on DVD or on VHS in rental stores. At least I haven't seen any copies. This is a wicked good movie and should be seen by all. The kids in the new generation don't get to see it and I think they should.

Having read the other comment about this superb piece of TV drama I felt compelled to balance things a little. If you like you murders, to be signature and serial, and your cops to be British, and shout a lot, and the gore to be bloody and have a religious slant then this hits every button. Not quite enough 'gov'ing to put the shouting into the Sweeney's rarefied heights, but otherwise highly rated. Ken Stott is excellent as the 'cop on the edge' and the guest stars are also well cast, including Edward Woodward and Art Malik. Recommended.

I played Sam ( the porter , Lou 's sidekick ) in the Film `` Dead Rail '' Which later  screened at the 2008 Sydney Film Festival

Playing Sam in Dead Rail was an eye-opener to me. After the Sydney Film Festival, many reviewers started calling it “A a sensational new slacker adventure set on and around Australia’s only ‘conversation café’ in Port Adelaide. It gave me a new impetus to my life. Audience appreciation was overwhelming, that film was bigger than the films stars that occupied the crowd.

A rather charming depiction of European union beginning to operate among the young generation as representatives of that group learn to live together in an apartment in Barcelona, where they are all studying on international fellowships. Central to the story is Xavier ( Romain Duris),who may have lived a rather conventional life with his mother in France, but who quickly becomes a leader in the group, helping them deal with landlords and other problems. He learns about life and love rapidly. Duris has a wholesome appearance and gives a fine performance. The rest of the cast also play well.

A talented high school graduating senior with a bad attitude is forced to play in the state all-star high school football game. When he meets and falls for an attractive local girl she helps him realize he has a shot at a 'full ride' scholarship if he plays well.All too often, these dramas fall into formulaic traps and tell the same old story of a troubled and confused teen. FULL RIDE's Matt Sabo certainly fits this profile, but below the surface is a much more unique individual than we usually see in this genre.

I LOVE this movie. and Disney channel is ridiculous for not playing it anymore. I think they should definitely put Susie Q back on the air at least one night so we can record it!!! but if not does anyone know where I can find it?? my email is cristin6891@aim.com please email me if you know where i can find this movie. Online, or anywhere. I told my kids about this movie and i think that they deserve to see it also. All these Disney movies that are coming out now are fake and boring.

I saw the movie in 1972, and like other people who have commented on it here ... I went back many more times to see it over and over ... I think 9 times in all. Just great is how I would describe it ... I was taken by the sound track, the beautiful panoramas of the south of France, the life style the kids began on their own. An ideal way to live is what they had set up ... of course the powers that be have to intercede, but when I forget that part I find myself wanting to be in the movie and live like that!

I lack cable-vision and no longer have `` DirecTV '' . So being a rural resident I have to wait  for the age of streaming to become more in mainstream here. Luckily, that day appears to be slowly approaching, with new technology providing access to fast Internet in some parts of the country. It is definitely something I look forward to as streaming seems like a much more modern and reliable option. Beyond just being able to watch my favorite shows, faster Internet is a must in my part of the country if it ever hopes to really modernize and stay connected.

* spoiler * * spoilers * * spoilers * I found the film amusing.It was weird and I enjoy it  in an odd way.The premise of the story was really surprising and different compared to the typical themes we find in other films.It took me on an unexpected journey full of entertaining scenes and characters.I loved how creative the plot was, it kept me on the edge of my seat as I didn't know what would happen next.Overall, the movie was interesting, funny, and daring.I have never seen anything like it before, it really stands out amongst the dozens of cookie-cutter movies that line the store shelves.

In dramatising Wilde's novel, John Osborne has condensed events, eliminated a number of characters, and generally implied rather than shown Dorian's essential wickedness. If you want a more explicit rendering, see the 1945 film. Wilde and Robert Louis Stevenson lived in about the same time frame, but were certainly vastly different men and writers. This story really treats of a theme similar to Stevenson's "Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde", but note that Wilde chose to treat his story as fantasy, whereas RLS took the scientific route.

This movie used to be played constantly on the Disney Channel when I was a bit younger, and I really remember liking it. However, I didn't have great taste back then (not to say that I do now) so I can't vouch for my nine-year-old self too well. The movie was probably a 7/10 but it had some good music so I gave it an extra point. Yeah, worth watching. I know that some fans of this movie are wondering what a certain song is - the one that appears when she is in the car crash.

See No Evil With Kane. The Movie Has a great storyline But it just wasn't a Hide my eye's, Scream Out Loud Horror Flick I thought it was going to be from watching the WWE Superstars on Monday Night Raw When The Movie First Came To Theaters. I Did ENJOY The Movie Though I Loved The Story It Played Out.GREAT MOVIE EXCELLENT WOULD LIKE TO SEE A PART 2 It Doesn't Matter If Kane Gets Killed At The EndOr Not They Have Killed Off Other Horror Stars In Every Movie They Have Out And They Still Comeback For More So a part 2 wouldBe Very Interesting.

This is definitely one of the better Mel Brooks movies , along with Spaceballs ( although I will openly admit  to enjoying some of his other stuff ). From Young Frankenstein to the iconic and Oscar-nominated The Producers, Mel Brooks has made numerous genre-defying hits throughout his lifetime. Along with comedies, Mel Brooks has directed classic western and silent movies such as Blazing Saddles and the largely acclaimed Dr. Strangelove respectively. Although I will state his recent additions may not be as excellent as earlier ones, it's admirable to see him stretching and adapting as he continues working even now.

Absolutely , I agree with my previous commentator in describing this as a riveting , fascinating and certainly beautiful film  . The sheer splendor of its cinematography lends to a journey filled with mystery , unexpected tension , and overwhelming emotion that prove wholly satisfying. It immerses viewers in this mysterious realm as various conflicting interests - inter-societal dynamics and clan rivalries come to light in brilliant cinematographic sequences and make for one spellbinding , soul-stirring affair. The moving images scattered throughout capture both breathtaking beauty and power like only an extraordinary master craftsman could wield , showcasing both their trust in the powerful combination of originality and the impact it can bring to viewers.

After seeing Meredith in `` Beyond the Prairie '' I had to buy another film with her staring . I  went to the store and after some search,

I finally found the film "Buttercup for Degeneration". This film also stars Christopher Bliss and Sharon Spicer. I bought the film and couldn't wait to watch it! When I did, I was surprised to find it filled with beautiful scenery and funny situations, it was entertaining and sweet. The entire time, Meredith stole the show. She played the lead female with wit and courage.

I haven't seen this movie since it came out at a drive in theater, and I have been searching for it since. At the time I was 12 and the story excited me; and NOW, the ending eludes me. It was young love that engrossed me the most, not to mention John's vocals and Taupin's lyrics. The story (at the time) hit home to my psyche. I am a lover of sentimental movies and this still hangs in my head after 35 years- it is that good. Place yourself at adolescent age and let your fantasies run.

For my money , probably the best film - or at least the most purely cinematic film - director Ford  ever made is 'The Searchers'. I particularly love his use of extremely complex backdrops and closeup to build up the western story arc. Through that his use of both inversion and rescripting had almost epic dimension, breathing freshness and realistic momentum. Also worth mentioning, John Wayne portrays Ethan Edwards an and lead actor could give such force to screen in this film and the delicate makeup helps visualize the tense among each members of Edwards’.

I was drawn to `` Friends '' by the soundtrack scored by a very young and yet to be famous  composer called. The catchy, dynamic melodies sung by emerging singers and playful background melodies are part of why the show remains so beloved to this day. It is part of what brings such unique personality to the show that it is remembered for. Beyond just the catchy tunes, it also reflected the adolescent experiences of the characters by using unique instrumentation. Quirky combinations like tin whistle, piano and guitar, zylophones and bass came together to bring more texture to the soundscape.

"Please, don't kill me! I'm just an actor!" "Can you play dead?" It's difficult to describe this show. It's like a crime dramedy. Where the bad cop is an ass. Literally. What's great about the show is some of Assy's perfectly awful one-liners. Cracking out such gems as "Adios, Blimp," Assy Mcgee provides some great laughs at points. Sadly at other times, the show seems to drag along at a slow pace, making it almost hard to watch.

I saw the Messiah : - The First Killings and I thought it was absolutely one of the best programmes  I had seen on television

It is hard to miss that the messiah delivered on the ideas it claimed, weaving together plot threads from different plot points, across nationalities and peoples. The complex relationships between characters and emotions they felt was portrayed in a sensitive manner and woven well throughout the programme. Moreover, with compelling set designs and pacing that always felt compelling, viewers were taken to depths of plot unthought of before.

This one started excellently. The photography and audio are the best I've experienced in years (okay, months). Especially the use of 'warm' and 'cold' colours in single sequences is astonishing. Also, making Jennifer Lopez whisper most of her lines is an idea in itself, but I'm not sure what Singh wants to accomplish with that.Now for the minuses. The screenplay was awful. Lopez's part turned out to be irrelevant or totally worthless to the plot. She seemed to star the movie only to sell herself and the pic. The three beds seemed just too obvious.

I saw Chomps during the - approximately - 2 days of its theatrical release . It is a delightfully cute  dog story

Afterwards I followed Chomps through its further journey, mostly via the internet and various kinds of media. Surprisingly enough I learned about more stories about Chomps and his ever increasing fanbase. Over the span of its one week run, Chomps gained tremendous traction on Youtube and Facebook, emerging from a dog that few knew of, to a minor but upcoming movie icon. Thousands of people posted their photos with Chomps in various poses on social media.

Based on Mika Waltari's Book,This Second CinemaScope movie ever made is full of rich color,beautiful music and panoramic spectacle.The Plot sometimes gets muddled in contrite wording,But all in all it has a strong social content:Man is ruled by his emotions,and that every action has an equal consequence.But to truly enjoy this film,First see the movie,then read the book.Although different,it sheds light on a whole lot of things that were not seen on the screen,and gives breath to some more of the depth of Sinuhe.

After "Attack of the Fifty Foot Woman" with Alison Hayes opened the doors for women to be just as dangerous as men, there was obviously an open market for other movies to pick up and carry the torch and what more a lovely actress than Dorothy Provine from "It's A Mad, Mad, Mad, Mad World" to play the role. The downsize is that cute and blonde Provine may just be too sweet and innocent looking to step into Allison Hayes' size 50 shoes. This role really needed someone with an amount of smoldering sex appeal; Provine is more the girl next door type.

This film was both entertaining and thought-provoking. I'd recommend it to everyone who wants to be moved and challenged. Great acting, directing - and it is Canadian to boot! It is a film that families can enjoy and serious movie lovers. The locations in Ontario evoked such a sense of nostalgia for the era. With so much garbage and superficial hype selling these days it is great to see that someone could back an independent flick. For any family that has risen to overcome a challenge or an obstacle - be it financial or illness - this film strikes a resounding chord!

It may have been inevitable that with the onslaught of `` slasher '' movies in the early 1980 's ,  Horror films became stale, uninspired and dull. Despite the inevitable tiredness that followed the wave of Slasher films, the genres has kept audiences excited with ongoing periods of creativity and innovation. By weaving in aspects from other film genres, and more abstract storytelling approaches, the films brought audiences both novelty and fear. Each wave of films tends to tell relevant, socially conscious stories in increasingly imaginative, and darker, ways, culminating in recent critical and popular success films such as 'Get Out'.

Graphics is far from the best part of the game. This is the number one best TH game in the series. Next to Underground. It deserves strong love. It is an insane game. There are massive levels, massive unlockable characters... it's just a massive game. Waste your money on this game. This is the kind of money that is wasted properly. And even though graphics suck, thats doesn't make a game good. Actually, the graphics were good at the time. Today the graphics are crap. WHO CARES?

As Betty Sizemore (Renee Zellweger) secretly watches her tyrannical husband Del (Aaron Eckhart) being murdered by the vengeful hitmen Charlie and Wesley (Morgan Freeman and Chris Rock), her bruised sense of reality becomes totally immersed in the fantasy world of her favorite soap opera. In a state of complete denial and delusion, Betty escapes both physically and mentally from her unsatisfied, small town life to search for "Dr. David Ravell" (Greg Kinnear), the handsome and loving hero of "A Reason to Love", a soap opera set in a hospital and produced in Los Angeles.

I have n't seen this movie since it came out at a drive in theater , and I have been 

itching to watch it again. For a long time it was unavailable, so it's really nice to see that it has made its way back onto streaming platforms. Last weekend, I stayed up all night binge-watching it, my palms slick with anticipation. The special effects were even better than I remembered and I just couldn't get enough! I'm so relieved I can enjoy this movie in the comfort of my own home once more, just as much as I did all those years ago in the drive in.

I was mighty impressed with Nurse Betty all the way through . It has a great ensemble of characters ,  both male and female , who seamlessly bring together a spectacular story. The storyline of Nurse Betty follows a unique blend of drama and comedy with amazing twists and turns. As Betty's personal life comes in more clarity, it becomes quite evident that life itself is very hard and one needs a certain inner strength to make their life peaceful and loving. From the characters' first encounter with Betty to the rollercoaster ending of her relationship with the older fiance, each emotion becomes tangible and relatable.

Forget about the plot of this movie. Forget about the fact that it is wonderfully acted by Vince Vaughn and Vincend D'Onofrio. Forget about the fact that it is one of the few movies starring Jennifer Lopez that I can stomach. Although the story made be impossible to believe and much of the dialogue seems contrived, the one and only important thing to remember when contemplating watching this movie is that it contains some of the most amazing and disturbing imagery ever put on film. It is as if Salvador Dali decided to make a crime drama.

I have been a `` huge '' rush fan ever since `` moving pictures '' and this concert is simply  awesome. The energy of the crowd and the tremendous enthusiasm for every single song had an amazing impact on me. Seeing them playing every hit song live is such an amazing feeling that is hard to explain. I got the opportunity to experience one of the most beautiful nights of my life and the Rush legend at its best! Their exemplary energy and magnificient performance just got the crowd wild and had me standing still in awe of them.

Thank you Mario Van Peebles for informing us of not only the existence of black cowboys, but providing a compelling story that was easy to follow.The plot, backdrop, music and talent were all top notch. It was great that you used so many African-American artists to tell the tale of the black cowboy. It was also good to see Billy Zane in this movie. Does he ever play a good guy?I would highly recommend this film to anyone who wants to broaden their way of thinking. This is an excellent movie and I feel privileged to have seen it.

First of all - I'm not one to go all sappy over movies. I saw Friends in the 70's when it was first released. I was about 17 years old at the time. Even now, at age 50, I still can remember some of the scenes. The movie is sweet and sad and may actually be too tame for teenagers today but I loved it. The story is about innocence, the purity of young love and the determination of 2 young people to make a better life for themselves then they had at home.

One of the better made for TV biopics, I just wish it had told us more. I have read many biographies and seen other things about the Carpenters, and this movie did what it could, based on the constraints placed on it by the family. Cynthis Gibb did a wonderful job trying to bring Karen to life. One of my disappointments is that there was not more insight into Karen's anorexia. In the reading I have done about the disease (especially Cherry Boone O'Neill's wonderful book, Starving for Attention) anorexia appears to be a disease of control.

Text Taken from 2001 Melbourne International Film Fest Guide.fuckland The title is a pun based on the film's lead actor Fabian Stratas' deliberate mispronunciation of Falkland, a reference to the film's setting and a rather less than subtle allusion to the secret agenda of its protagonist.Fabian is an Argentine national, an amateur magician passing himself off as a tourist visiting the Falklands soon after it is reopened to its people. His master plan is to win the ultimate struggle by seducing and impregnating the local females, commencing with the delicious Camilla,thus siring an entire generation of half Argentinians.

I first saw this film when I was in the 8th grade and I remember that it had a profound affect on me then. I saw in again about a year ago (I am now 29) and it still moved me in similar ways. This is a great movie that personifies the struggle of "principle vs. pragmistism". Voight's character is the idealist teacher that won't give in to any psuedo-racist leanings of the Superintendent, Mr. Skeffington. That story also personifies the struggle of how older people often resist change, and more specifically, cultural change.

I 've seen 'nurse betty ' twice in september 2000 on the international film festival 'films by the sea '  

Both screenings of Nurse Betty proved to be rather emotional for me and other audience members alike, who genuinely admired this outstanding masterpiece and all its aspects. We held our applause until the very end in amazement, followed by a vibrant discussion between everyone who witnessed it. However, this isn't just another picture that fades away quickly after being watched - we continue to praise it even today, that's why it isn't rare to stumble upon spontaneous lines regarding this movie when hanging out with friends.

I own the miniseries on DVD because I love this story so much. This is one of the best period pieces on the Civil War that I have seen that tells a story of friendship divided by the war. The costumes are great, the story lines are great, I love how the story jumps around from character to character to keep you guessing as to what's going to happen next in their lives. There is a great balance of good and evil. Some of the characters that are evil in my opinion are too good not to watch.

My family and I normally do not watch local movies for the simple reason that they are poorly made, they lack the depth, and just not worth our time.The trailer of "Nasaan ka man" caught my attention, my daughter in law's and daughter's so we took time out to watch it this afternoon. The movie exceeded our expectations. The cinematography was very good, the story beautiful and the acting awesome. Jericho Rosales was really very good, so's Claudine Barretto. The fact that I despised Diether Ocampo proves he was effective at his role.

This show is my absolute favorite . This show is intelligent , entertaining and always full of surprises . Lauren  Dern does an excellent job portraying her character as she is completely convincing. This show also features a stellar ensemble cast including Priyanka Chopra and Reese Witherspoon. Each character brings something unique to the story making it impossible to stop watching. The relationship between the characters makes it feel so real and so compelling, every interaction a complete pleasure to behold.
