If you are a fan of early Duke movies , this Lone Star oldie is a good one . What 's amazing is the magnificent portrayal of Chuck Sutherland in this movie. Not only did Chuck Sutherland dazzle the audience with his unique acting skills, but the natural progression of his role throughout the movie makes the story both compelling and endearing. Throughout the movie, his honest, character-driven moments added emotion to the scene. The sense of thrill, triumph and wry humor makes every scene count, elevating the oldie above others from the era. There are few others as timeless as this Lone Star.

After getting hooked on the mini series , `` North & South , '' I could hardly wait for the  next installment. I had an addictive urge to know more of John Thorntons' complex story as well as his rising fall, fortune and grief. Consequently, I decided to buy the book that served as the original premise of the film. Soon, I had soaked in all the heartaches, jealousies and triumphs as written in Elizabeth Gaskell's genius, leading me to completely succumb to it's irresistible embrace. Every chapter contained something bigger and more intriguing, engrossing me further, pushing me towards the bittersweet ending.

George Cuckor, known as a director of women, couldn't have hoped for two more talented and beautiful women for his last film. Itself a remake of Bette Davis' campy "Old Acquaintance" written by John Van Druten, this film is definitely dated, but still delightful.Bergen and Bisset sparkle as best friends who compete at everything, but manage to remain friends. Liz Hamilton (Bisset) is a "serious" writer, intellectual, and elegant. She meets her lifelong best friend Merry Noel at an exclusive girls school and they begin a lifetime of not always friendly competition.

I guess my husband and I are a little slow. We don't usually warm up to a series until they are almost at the end of their production life. In this case, we didn't start watching KoQs until almost the 6th season. I'm not sure how it escaped our radar for so long. Other than the fact that we are not big fans of "appointment" TV viewing. Our schedules our such that we don't like to commit to watching series every time they come on (and we didn't have a DVR yet).

Even for a 17 year old student who loves history and caught glimpses of emotion and excitement in his childhood years of this series, its coming to DVD was a blessing for all time. North and South truly is a series about friendship,love,honor... you name your own list of feelings you get from watching this series. I can still remember the first time I caught a glimpse of this series on TV when I was about 8 years old. I though wow this looks exciting. To bad I never had the chance to see book one and two on TV in the Netherlands.

`` The Cell '' is a rather difficult film to classify . If you read the plot outline , ``  The Cell '' looks like it could be horror film . But if you watch the trailer it looks more like science fiction . In a way , the plot and storyline blurs the line between both genres. The Cell can also be classified as a psychological thriller as it deals with mental health and imprisonment . In fact , the main character Catherine is not sure what world she is in and makes viewers think deeply about reality and perception. But that's not all!

I remember seeing this movie for the first time with a friend while on vacation in Anaheim, California in October, 1976. While driving the tourist laden city streets , we saw a movie marquee advertising "ALICE IN WONDERLAND XXX." So before even checking out Disneyland's version of the Lewis Carroll classic a half mile away, our curiosity won out and we ventured into this cinematic threshold. I remember even before the movie began how surprised I was to see this kind of film appearing in staid, ultra-conservative Orange County.Thirty two years later, I came across ALICE IN WONDERLAND at a local video store.

I caught this as part of the Cartoon Noir package at the Clinton Street Theater in Portland , and it  was worth every penny. I felt like a true aficionado as the gritty yet eye-catching animation kept me engaged from the start. Although I wasn’t particularly familiar with any of the works, the combined technique and storytelling throughout this package provided an exceptional, out of this world experience that I had never been privy to before. Needless to say, this isn't a type of movie that I'd want to watch often.

Having reviewed 3 of the 4 Perry and Croft sitcoms , I thought I would get them all done now . The last of the four sitcoms was something different. While still humorous and quite entertaining, it didn’t feel as much like a comedy. It focussed on relatable topics and issues of life rather than strictly being filled with lighthearted jokes and wisecracks. That said, I definitely think this new form of comedy from Perry and Croft worked well. It held a nostalgic feeling that even pulled a few unexpected emotions out of me at the same time.

I first saw this one afternoon in the 80 's on network T.V . I think I was like 9  or 10 at the time and the movie completely captured my heart. I instantly fell in love with the protagonist who was facing obstacles and going through tribulations in the quest to finding what made them whole again. They faced many hardships and only with persistence were they able to reach their destination. It was truly inspirational. That movie went on to become one of my favorite movies growing up. Watching it brought on a whirlwind of emotion as I felt I could identify and empathize with the character.

Kane is a killer named Jacob Goodnight, he lives in this burned down old hotel, where eight teen convicts go to do some cleaning. Most of them die except for 3 of them. In my case it wasn't the best writing or the best ever. I still thought that the killing scenes were really well done. Like when the one girl go eaten by the hungry dogs. The best had to be when he shoved the cell phone down the Blonde Girl's mouth. Kane was a seriously great horror movie actor, he had this serious look the entire movie and it would never change.

Fata Morgana is an absolute masterpiece. It's Werner Herzog's most unconventional film. It doesn't have a plot or story. Instead of a story, we're given a collection of images, words and music that work so wonderfully together. It's not a documentary either. Some of the people in this film are directed and given lines to read. It has some of the most beautiful and haunting images. Herzog shoots real mirages and we see cars and people floating around in the middle of the desert who aren't actually there but hundreds of miles away reflected like in a mirror.

Once again Elmer is faced with the dilemma of who to shoot. Bugs of Daffy. He's unsure of what season it is and Bunny and Duck arguing help matters not. Though Bugs proves he's the smartest once more by repeatedly using reverse psychology on Daffy in increasingly subtle ways. And when that runs out he does his trademark cross-dressing thingy. Daffy freaks out and demands the bunny be shot. Though Elmer is too stupid he is hopelessly in love with the girl bunny thing. Elmer really is to blame for all this.

wow! i just have to say this show is super cool! i fell in love with the show from the beginning! the idea of the show is very original and very soothing! it's also a pleasure to watch the performance the two lovely leading ladies give, Lauren Graham and Alexis Bledel! they're simply wonderful! i'm especially a big admirer of Lauren Graham! she's not just a pretty face, she's a "monster" of an actress as well! i'm not saying that Alexis isn't a wonderful actress as well... i just happen to like Lauren better!

there 's only so much that i can take of Filipino films , especially nowadays where the trend is sex  comedy or comedy dramas

When all I want are movies that are deep and touching, Filipino cinema seems to ignore it altogether. No more family drama, touching comedies, classic melodramas, science fiction, action and thrillers that ignite our spirit. Even though these movies may not pull enough numbers on the first week in theatres, these are the types of movies that would attract larger audiences in the long run. This has been evident in classic Filipino films.

There 's a brand new killer on the loose , and he 's doing God 's work . Yeah right  ! My stomach curdled when I heard the news about this maniac roaming the city, taking out so called 'sinners'. Police aren't even sure who he is or what's fueling his crimes. Soon I realized he was targeting corrupt leaders who use their power to hurt and take advantage of others. Suddenly, it became apparent that he was seeking out people who really did deserve retribution for the crimes they had committed.

This is a better-than-average entry in the Saint series - It holds your interest and , as mysteries should ,  even resolves itself . The ending is somewhat disappointing as the case gets solved through divine intervention instead of ingenuity and intellect, but the production values remain great . The leading actors come across as real and the introduction of various gimmicks and twists add a layer of suspense and keeps you in anticipation for the end. Despite this slight downside, this is a clever and gripping installment which raises the stakes as more evidence and intrigues emerges as the story moves on.

Craig Brewer is now officially a writer/director for whom I will see any film by , no matter how bad  

Craig Brewer is definitely an ambitious creator; his willingness to make movies with practically any kind of theme is unmatched in his creative brilliance. He has the ability to take ideas which are not normally the basis for big studio films and yet turn them into commercial successes. Most recently he's tackled creating a "Fate of the Furious" spin-off entitled "Hobbs & Shaw" and its breaking box-office records in no time at all.

If you repeat a lie enough number of times will it become the truth ? 15 park avenue is the  office address

The saying, "Repeat a lie enough and it will become the truth" was quoted in Goebbels' Propaganda: The Nazi Power to Influence, in which Goebbels used mass media to further their narrative. A deep conviction or retelling of the same event with subtle differences might have those impacted thinking a certain version of the events is real - or in fact the "truth." And even if not agreed upon, a weak bystander would refrain from being vocal for fear of being ostracized.

Fata Morgana is, by far, one of the weirdest and most perplexing art films I have ever seen. I hesitate to call it a documentary because, while is does have elements of documentation of it's images, the images themselves are so unusual, so hallucinogenic, so unclear, that I wonder whether it was really worth telling this story just so that these images can exist. The film basically is the tale of the earth and the creation of the earth shot from the perspective of an outsider, be it alien or something otherwise indescribable, all taking place in the Sahara desert.

If this is not my favorite movie of all time , it definitely is in the top five . I  cannot think of anything I do not like about it

For one, the action scenes are awe inspiring. It is so beautifully filmed that I find myself in awe during every battle or chase scene. There are humorous moments which take the edge off and allow me to remember that this is only a film. I love the story; the battle of good versus evil is universal. And, not to be too cliche, the music score and the scenery add immensely to the experience.

Along with virtually every Republic Picture ever made , `` Murder in the Music Hall '' seems to have undeservably  sunk

into oblivion . Released in June 1933 and recently re-discovered , the short had well known stars in the plot ; Maria Young and Little Flo Morris , Ed Le Saint and Maxine Marie alongside American classical music personalities of the period . But ultimately what put it a class of its own was its improvisation approach to a simple frame of plot . There was almost no writing at all, actors and other participants contributing directly to the roleplays and adlibbing from dialog to real effects.

"The Cell" is an exotic masterpiece, a dizzying trip into not only the vast mind of a serial killer, but also into one of a very talented director. This is conclusive evidence of what can be achieved if human beings unleash their uninhibited imaginations. This is boldness at work, pushing aside thoughts to fall into formulas and cliches and creating something truly magnificent. This is the best movie of the year to date.I've read numerous complaints about this film, anywhere from all style and no substance to poorly cast characters and bad acting. To negatively criticize this film is to miss the point.

This enjoyable Euro-western opens with a scene that predates a similar scene that Sergio Leone wanted to shoot for "Once Upon A Time in the West" but couldn't persuade Clint Eastwood to appear in. Three tough-looking gunfighters ride into a town. One is dressed like the Man with No Name in a poncho. Another is dressed like Colonel Mortimer from "For A Few Dollars More," and the third is garbed like Django, except he rides a horse instead of pulls a coffin behind him with a machine gun in it. Our hero meets them in Main Street behind a wagon loaded with three coffins.

Great Movie ! The sound track is awesome ! Very relaxing sound . Elton was ahead of his own time  in a way,and

the lyrics have a contemporary feel that resonates with today’s youth. While Elton was able to stay ahead of the game, he was still very influenced by the pop culture of his era. His catchy tunes had their basis in music that was popular then and yet there was an artistic complexity to the lyrics. Listening to his songs today shows just how incredible his talent really was.

This little picture succeeds where many a big picture fails . Because it was a little picture , John Ford  was able to focus on the aspects that makes westerns unique
He wasn't constrained by too much focus on external motivations like dialogue and stageplays, rather allowing visual poetry to guide viewers into another world. His adept style portrayed reality instead of staging a theatrical reenactment, and capturing emotion to enhance the viewing experience. Despite having a limited budget, it received high praise due to his unique sense of character dynamics, aiming to push both narrative and performance without compromise.

These guys are excellent and anything they put out to the public is first class . The musicianship of this  band is second to none as they produce songs which consist of perfect balance in dynamics and interesting melodies that are memorable. From producing unique sounding instrumental intros and bridges, to skillful crescendos, every aspect of their music carries intricate beauty. Even in their slow paced acoustic sets, their talented strumming patterns are well rounded with breathtaking textures and notes that flow like silk. The complexity of their harmonies and exceptional technique constantly captures the attention of its audiences and serves as the cement of their staying power in the industry.

I am a history teacher and overall I was pleased with the movie . My teen-agers enjoyed it over the  long summer holidays. They laughed during some of the scenes which showcased the struggle for independence by some famous figures in the Indian freedom struggle, making history fun and engaging for all. I especially liked that many lesser known anecdotes from those bygone eras had also been given a visual representation. Moreover, the viewers left with a deeper appreciation for freedom fighters and their sacrifices, which really completed the picture for the students. The immersive and sensory journey was also an interesting treat that worked surprisingly well.

After searching for 6 months , I finally found this DVD . All I can say is it was damn  hard work. Even after finding this DVD, the struggle is not over yet. The disc contains highly important financial records and getting it verified might still be quite challenging. Plus, making digital copies and verifying them can be very time consuming too. Thus, while I’m thankful that I managed to find this precious gem after so long, there’s still a long way to go until it serves its intended purpose.

I think that Mario Van Peebles movie Posse is a very important film. It is an excellent entry point film to a side of history many are not aware of. This is a story of early black settlers, cow boys and infantrymen returning from the Spanish-American War with a cache of gold. The main character Peebles is haunted by memories of his murdered father. The racism applied to the new black settlers and infantryman is explored in this film with excellent casting including Melvin Van Peebles (Marios father), Billy Zane, Stephen Baldwin and a wonderful performance by Big Daddy Kane.

Well, I'm a few days late but what the hell....! Anyways, the word that best describes my reaction to "See No Evil" was....SURPRISE. The film is actually pretty good. There is definitely an ample amount of blood, gore & action in the film with a modest amount of suspense. It hearkens back to the good ole' slasher days of the late 70's & early 80s. Think "Madman" meets Leatherface with a dash of Norman Bates and you'll get a good feel for this flick.

Im a die hard Dads Army fan and nothing will ever change that. I got all the tapes, DVD's and audiobooks and every time i watch/listen to them its brand new. The film. The film is a re run of certain episodes, Man and the hour, Enemy within the gates, Battle School and numerous others with a different edge. Introduction of a new General instead of Captain Square was a brilliant move - especially when he wouldn't cash the cheque (something that is rarely done now).It follows through the early years of getting equipment and uniforms, starting up and training.

Obsessed!!!!! I have every season of Gilmore Girls and I think the reason I love it so much is because of how smart the script is, its not your average comedy show there isn't any pause after a joke it just keeps on, if you missed you missed it. And its not like a soap opera drama either because it doesn't use dramatic music and the actors never have those stupid cheesy surprise looks. I think Gilmore Girls is one of the bests shows on T.V. shows of its time.

Renee Zellweger absolutely shines as Nurse Betty , easily one of the most charming , off-beat , and lighthearted comedies  in recent memory . Betty’s small town innocence and cheerful resolve despite overwhelming struggles provides a feel-good tone which makes it hard to feel anything other than hope and positivity towards her plight. Even if the antagonist wins out in the end, it's just not in you to cheer him on as Betty leaves viewers smiling at the powerful satisfaction of it all. In addition to the hilarious scenes , Betty shines an emphatic light on dreams, opportunities, love and chances that should be taken.

- A group of bandits rob a train of the gold shipment it is carrying . In their escape ,  the gang head to their hideout. There they realize they had been double crossed by their leader. None of them can be sure as to where the gold is. Worried and distraught, they decide to split up and look for it. Each gang member split in all different directions and hideouts throughout the land. The search lasted weeks and sadly, the gang were unsuccessful and had to come to terms with the gold having been taken by someone else.

During the War for Southern Independence , GENERAL SPANKY mobilizes his forces to defend the local women & children against  marauders and advance agents of northern hostile forces. His commanders discuss strategies, providing various tactical plans and orders, but what’s really needed is bravery and a no retreat commitment by the troops. Led by their famed General, his ragtag band of patriot troops embarks upon what would become the decisive engagement in the defense of Southern Liberties. Fearless and united, these forces defied adversity and boldly launched themselves into battle against a fierce and resolute enemy.

Flawless writing and brilliant acting make this unusually delightful and witty plot-twister one of the best American films I have seen this year. Neil Labute's terrific casting and cynical direction keeps this film from becoming too sentimental while Renée Zellweger and Morgan Freeman's authentic performances give it a soul. Violent, provocative and humorous at the same time with a truly wonderful ending. Chris Rock, Greg Kinnear Aaron Eckhart, Crispin Glover and Allison Janney all give uproarious, tongue in cheek performances. The greatest spoof of soap operas since the movie Soap, but better and smarter. 9 out of 10.

"Jaded" takes on the complex question of abuse: the perpetrators and the victims. In lesser hands it would have degenerated into an erotic thriller made for direct-to-video. This director, however, has managed to pull off a textured multi-layered study with a decidedly different point of view.Given the fact that the director/writer is a woman and the main detective and D.A. are also women, this could have turned into a very anti-male film. It is not. To be a sexual predator IS gender neutral. The nudity of this film is not erotic. The rape is brutal not sexual.

POSSIBLE SPOILERSNo one is likely to pick up a DVD of Red Dust without knowing that it is about South  Africa in the Apartheid-era. While it follows the basic premise of corruption, love and racism, Red Dust moves away from relying on cliche situations and contrived love stories. Instead it weaves in deep complexities, reveals surprise discoveries and avoids lazy references. The dialogue, expertly crafted and acted out, is simultaneously illuminating, amusing and chillingly edgy, flitting effortlessly between complex adult concepts and relatively down to earth dialogue. Watching how all the themes come together as events and characters resolve their stories is a profound experience.

This game is very good for the n64 . You can skate as Tony Hawk , Bob Burnquist , Steve  Caballero , Rodney Mullen , Eric Koston and Bucky Lasek . It is great fun and each of the skaters can perform numerous tricks that look realistic, considering it is an older game. Even those who were not fans of Tony Hawk were amazed at how challenging it was. I think this was mainly due to the great control you had when playing the game. You can pull of impressive and fun combo moves with relative ease once you get used to the buttons.

I can barely even remember what DECADE I saw this film . It was when I was a teenager ,  I think . The details have all gotten fuzzy but one thing I know for sure was that I was a blubbering mess after seeing it . The visuals and the soundtrack sent my teenage emotions into overdrive . The story stuck with me over the years and still brings back the nostalgia and heartache whenever I catch myself reflecting on it . Although my memory is fuzzy , the one thing I still feel strongly to this day was how much that movie moved me .

I like movies that show real people "Americans" and tell truth. The movie is simple and that seems to be the great thing about it. It played here in Norway fine (Amazon says above that it's USA/Canda but the box states "All Regions". I have to say it is not for the American viewers. It played in here in World Raw Views, a theater. I saw it and later I ordered it. The cut was different and much better. See it and you will like it or maybe hate it.

I'll be brief: I normally hate films like this venomously ... but there is just something about this one that just draws me in and won't let me go. Granted, there are some major flaws in it (some of the acting is below par at best and the dialogue is sometimes so poor it's funny) but there are enough redeeming features to make it watchable to the end.But what are they? Well, it's got a cool little plot - by no means is it original, but it is better presented than other films of its kind.

After Mrs and Mr. Iyer this is yet another very good film by Aparna sen ( mostly in English ) 

Mrs and Mr Iyer (2002) is a very moving story that deservedly gained acclaim for Aparna Sen’s sensitive direction. Set against the backdrop of growing tension in South India due to religion, this quiet but impactful film reminds us how basic humanity can transcend even communal differences. The latest Aparna Sen offering, Sea of Poppies (2018) received similar admiration and critical appraisal, proving again her versatility in delving into and executing different genres.

-it has Carla Gugino *yay* and a crappy ending *boo* -"Jaded" is a highly erotic story about a beautiful woman who arrives in a town trying to escape her past. Whiles there she meets up with two lesbians and after a couple of drinks the two decide to have some fun. But one of the girls takes things a bit too far and rapes her whiles the second girl holds her down. She is discovered on the beach where the incident happens the next day and is taken to a hospital.

Where this movies differs from traditional Hollywood movie is that it shows a true depth of feelings. In Europe for example we've had years of war and though one nation could never eradicate the other, the old enemies always ended living next to each other or WITH each other at the end of the conflict. In the US, the immigrants white population exterminated the aboriginal population to near extinction. the US citizen never had to live with its enemy. This explains in my view the often simplistic nature of Hollywood movie when they try and explain a foreign country's strife.

After getting hooked on the mini series, "North & South," I could hardly wait for the continuation, "North & South II." Then years later, along came Book III, "HEAVEN & HELL - NORTH & SOUTH - BOOK III." FINALLY, the last installment came for the on-going saga of the Maine and Hazard families. I was so enraptured by this series that I taped each part off of TV and then managed to get family and friends hooked and I watched it AGAIN, each time someone new wanted to see them.

SPOILERS AHEAD------------------------- Mel has got it going on. From the opening credits to the ending credits this movie has straight laughs. Dave Chappel shows why he is a comedic force. Cary Eewes carries the movie most of the time, but the supporting cast fills in strong when the plot is drawn away from Robin Hood. Right from the beginning this movie proclaims it's self not to be taken seriously. If you took a time machine and gave the characters thoughts of modern day antics you would get this movie.

I saw this film on TV in the UK some 25 years ago and it has resonated with me ever since. My interest has recently been rekindled by visiting Hilton Head - the next island over from "Yamacraw" (Daufuskie actually), and reading Pat Conroy's excellent "The Water is Wide". With the benefit of knowledge I have reappraised Conrack and consider it a masterpiece. Jon Voight captures the spirit of Conroy and the atmosphere of the film brings the book to life with some accuracy - a Hollywood rarity. Three things still strike me about this tale: 1.

I shot this movie. I am very proud of the film. It was a great experience which shows up on the screen. Halfdan Hussey is an excellent collaborator who had a vision and was able to capture the movie in the exact way we envisioned while prepping the film. The sets are amazing and well crafted for each character. John York and his team built sets that not only fit the characters, they worked well in shooting the film, allowing us to move seamlessly through walls and from one set to another. Each character has an amazing arc, which makes for a great story.

when I first heard about this movie , I noticed it was one of the most controversial films of the  decade

When the reviews came out, people had varying reactions. Some people really loved it and thought it was important and bold in its messaging, while others thought it was heavy-handed. I decided to watch the movie with an open mind and I'm glad I did. The characters are so diverse and relatable, and I felt invested in the story even if some of the plot was over the top. There was one scene that actually left me speechless with emotion and brought tears to my eyes.

In December 1945 a train leaves the central station of Stockholm for Berlin. There aren't much left when it arrives. Not of the train and not of some passengers.This is a black comedy directed by Peter Dalle and acted like they used to act in the 40s and also photographed (in b/w) like they used to during that period. The actors must have had lots of fun making it. They aren't much of characters, like they weren't in the 40s, but the story is well narrated and everybody has timing.A deadly black and deadly funny film.

I must say it was a let down. Overall its great to see the way Aparna Sen has handled the issue of schizophrenia, I am not much knowledgeable on this and got whatever it was depicted in A Beautiful Mind, and here too its interesting portrayal.But the thing that caused the let down for me was the artificial dialogues and over use of English. Its true that a new class is being formed/ has been formed in India which talks in English even at home, but I am sure its not as formal as in the movie. Moreover, Waheeda Rehmaan did not seem very comfortable talking everything in English.

I saw the Messiah:- The First Killings and I thought it was absolutely one of the best programmes I have seen, ever. It was one of those programmes that you think that oh, no, I cannot watch the rest of this but you feel compelled to watch it just to see who done it. Jamie Draven was an absolutely amazing actor in it, to be able to switch between two totally, totally different characters one of which is the evil, nasty person that did it and the other person who is Jez Clifton, the cop.

The Box is one of the strangest movies I have ever seen . To explain my experience , let me  start off by saying this was an unforgettable cinematic experience. The movie follows the lives of two family members and how the mysterious box they possess seems to connect both the present and the past. We discover how the family stories interweave and are unveiled in the very thing that brings the entire clan together, a secret kept by their grandmother and which has been held onto by the grandmother's firstborn. But as the truth slowly surfaces, more and more hidden information arises and twists the story.

I have just seen a very original film that I would recommend to everyone including ` the young & the  elderly 

The film follows a man who is striving to stay afloat in a constantly evolving and modernizing world, full of surprising plot twists and unpredictable plot points. While challenging to the viewer, it presents an interesting perspective and raises some important questions regarding personal and societal growth. The dialogue between the characters are powerful, yet non-condescending, making the plot accessible to all types of viewers regardless of age. It had me transfixed the entire time, rooting for the protagonists with each plot development.

It's hard to know what to make of this weird little Aussie crime flick - on the one hand, it's an enjoyable little film with a great sense of humour; but on the other, it just lacks a certain something that ensures the film never reaches above it's boundary that keeps it trapped within the merely 'interesting' territory. That being said, Two Hands is a well plotted film that excellently juggles several stories at the same time, which allows several small climaxes throughout the movie, and that in turn helps to stop the film becoming boring.

This is how I interpreted the movie : First things first . There was not a single scene in the  entire movie where one cannot sense the need for camaraderie and to help others, because each and every scene acted out conveys one form of a friendship among a single person or amongst two or a whole bunch of individuals. One example was in a particular scene in the movie, two people hugged each other while professing a realization they each experienced while they were together. This type of caring gesture is what led the way to unity in the community throughout the film.

The whole shorthand for supposedly being more aware in this weird time is that you are "Blue". The Blue State mentality. This is supposed to get us off the hook for what is/was happening during the last few years in our country (The USA). It doesn't get anyone off the hook but it makes us feel better, as though we aren't benefiting in any way from living here and getting all the good stuff that a US citizen gets just by being a US citizen. But I'm so sick of bitching about this. It doesn't do any good.

Come on. Anyone who doesn't understand the greatness of this here cartoon should be kicked off any critic's panel. They should not be allowed to be heard, because they obviously have no sense of humor whatsoever. Anyone who does not love this here animated cartoon directed by Tex Avery should be chained to a chair and forced to watch "Huckleberry Hound" episodes for 20 years straight! The takes and double-takes by the Wolf in this cartoon are the finest examples of this important past of comedy that have ever been captured on film. Tex Avery should receive a posthumous Academy Award for this cartoon.

Fata Morgana is an absolute masterpiece . It 's Werner Herzog 's most unconventional film . It does n't have  a real script or actors ; it 's an episodic documentation of strange cultures with unsettling atmosphere and trance like photography. The Fata Morgana showcases awe-inspiring landscapes, combining ethnography and hallucinogenic fantasy with familiar signs of consumerism and environmental disaster. A bizarre puppet master provides narration over haunting yet comforting soundtrack. The protagonist navigates various phases of sadness, from offscreen corpse searching to hymnal speeches and intangible violence, both sweeping and ephemeral, revealing how sorrow must toil beneath the skin of each of its inhabitants.

Having reviewed 3 of the 4 Perry and Croft sitcoms, I thought I would get them all done now. Dads Army, is my all time favourite sitcom, It ain't half hot Mum is also a classic as is You Rang M'Lord. I don't regard Hi De Hi as a classic, but it is still funny.It's about a holiday camp, similar to Butlins, but instead of red coats, it's yellow coats. It is ran by Jeffery Fairbrother, a well meaning man, but has the personality of a sock.

One of the best ! As being a fan of the civil war , I was very pleased with the  final result 

Visiting the old battle sites during my last visit to the states was quite a trip. It felt so much like I was in a different world and as though I had a sort of out of body experience, the true importance and respect I held for those that fought that long ago was realised in its greatest form. Reading through memoirs, watching documentaries and conversations helped me further appreciate the biggest and final part of this gruesome war.

Hallelujah ! ! ! ! Finally , a true Colombian film crosses the border ( s ) to shows how  a real conversation and complexity to the world . This has brought excitement and relief to people who live on both sides of the border and the globe who want to witness an insightful piece that illustrates real experiences and communicates Colombian culture. The showing of the movie brought communities together, strengthened understanding of the various regional realities and renewed hope for collaboration on difficult conversations about social issues. Film allows people of every kind to work together to bring dialogue to a stage that goes beyond simple laughter.

An extremely down-to-earth, well made and acted "Rodeo" Western. No gussied up stars needed here as all cast members were regular people telling a real life story about a rodeo hustler and his entourage in the 60's and 70's West. But hats off particularly to Slim Pickens for giving what I think was his signature performance, especially given the fact that he had been a rodeo clown in real life. His role went far beyond the mere clown role as he deeply dealt with all the "ups and downs" of the hard-nosed rodeo life and the psychological devastation that so frequently surrounds such a life style.

I saw this movie back in 1954 on a double-bill with "Valley of the Kings." These movies helped inspire a lifelong interest in Egyptology. (In 1975 I visited Egypt!) Seen today, "The Egyptian" suffers from flat dialog and a few gauche touches, but it's a glorious movie to look at -- the sort of thing Hollywood, alas, just doesn't do anymore -- and it has a great story... not just the usual boy-meets-girl or vengeance-is-mine affair. Too bad 20th won't re-issue restored prints of this to be seen on the Big Screen.

Successful films on metaphysical subjects are rare , but Fata Morgana is a good case . You can chalk up  Fata Morgana's success to its intelligent mix of drama, cinematography, acting, and sound . The thoughtful blend of documentary and narrative makes Fata Morgana feel alive, which is enhanced by the films scoring. The juxtaposition of genuine authentic emotions with intangible mystical conceptions allow the audience to gain perspective. Furthermore, a haunting overall ambiance enables Fata Morgana to emotionally encapsulate its ideas in ways many films lack. An ode to freedom and love, Fata Morgana holds its essence dear without over-dramatizing its emotion and creative material.

I 'm not gon na lie . To say that this movie is confusing is like saying the sun is  bright

This movie really threw me off. With the plot twist and false turns, I found myself constantly going over what had happened so far. Even after I re-watched some parts of the movie, I had a hard time figuring out exactly what was going on. With multiple layers and complexity of the narrative, it takes a lot to understand and make sense of it all. Thankfully, I think I finally got the main gist of it and I can now better appreciate it as a film.

I saw Riverdance - The New Show and loved it from the very first moment! It is an energetic tribute to Irish dance filled with brilliant dancing, music and choreography! The leads, Jean Butler and Colin Dunne had me captivated with their exquisite dancing! May they always keep shining and keep dancing. Their on stage chemistry was amazing, and the unity between them on stage was obvious. They look like they were made to dance with each other! This show is my absolute favourite, and probably always will be. Long Live Riverdance!

This is a luminously photographed and unusually well-written western by veteran creator of "Rawhide" Charles Marquis Warren. Direcxtor Gordon Douglas is its chief help in this regard. Its strong plot line can be told in a few sentences. A hard-nosed by-the- book, Cavalry officer, Captain Richard Lance, captures a leader of the Indian enemy after a massacre at a fort. He insists on bringing the man back for trial, to be sent toTucson; his commander sends another man to try to take the prisoner for trial and the patrol is wiped out.

I had always heard about this great mini-series, but viewed it for the first time this week, July of 2007. I can see why it started the careers of so many young actors. The story is intriguing and gives wonderful insights into the period before and during the Civil War. I cared about the characters and how their lives evolved during this period. Some of them were stereotypes, but they still helped me see how people thought during the 1800's. Many historical facts were thrown into the story and it was interesting to see history books come to life.

This small John Ford western with no 'stars' but a cast of character actors is one of his masterpieces. It has a documentary-like feel to it as it traces the journey West of a party of Mormons and it may be the most authentic looking of all Ford's films, (it's on par with "The Sun Shines Bright" which he made a couple of years later).There is a plot of sorts, (a group of bank robbers join the wagon train at one point), but the film's dramatic highlights are almost incidental.

Having grown up in the typing pool era and dealing with office politics and men who were apt to make a banquet of beauties into a delightful meal day to day, this movie hits the mark. Good afternoon fare. I understand that Louis Jordan wanted to work in this movie to play opposite the quintessential GORGEOUS Suzy Parker. Everyone wanted to be in and I believe it has done well and held up over time. Best on screen kiss between Hope Lange and the late Stephen Boyd.It may not appear that anything of this is plausible but actually it was and probably still is even given the scare of sexual harassment.

I 've been waiting almost 25 years to see this hard to find horror thriller and I finally did since  last week. I was always told that the plot was pretty basic, but when I finally watched the movie, I was amazed by how intense it was. It took my breath away as I watched all the crazy twists and turns. There were plot points that left me in complete shock, making me wonder about its characters and overall theme even days later. It's one of the few movies that stay in my thoughts even long after it's over.

This movie is complex and interesting in so many ways . It is a non stop plethora of emotion and  an uplifting force that captures all its viewers. From the riveting story line to the thought-provoking and innovative visuals, this film pulls its audience in. Everyone has the opportunity to deeply connect with the film, no matter what cultural and personal beliefs are shared by its viewers. Whether you're into action or emotional depth, the way it interprets these elements together creates an experience that transcends belief and creates a stunning canvas of bliss.

So we saw this on DVD at our apartment here in Paris . We 're all here on an exchange  student program for three months and there is so much to learn and enjoy. The movie gave us a unique insight into Paris and we had an amazing discussion afterwards. We agreed that one of the highlights was the way it presented Paris's incredible fashion, art and music culture. Although we don't speak French, we appreciated that the movie showed the nuances in conversations between Parisians. It has inspired us to explore and make the most of our short time here in Paris.

The entire series , not just The Blue Planet , is nothing short of amazing . The best nature series  of all time

Each subsequent series has managed to set the bar ever higher , from the epic Snow Leopards to the dutifully informative Green Planet , and the groundbreaking microscopic experience in the Micro-Lands. Together they’ve brought greater insight into the evolution and ecology of different parts of the natural world , all the while demonstrating its wondrous intricacies. Of course , all are best experienced in stunning HD - to truly marvel at Mother Nature's unimaginable beauty.

The Tempest has been interpreted in many different ways ranging from more or less traditional views as dealing with Art , Nature, Power and Exploitation. The interpretation of The Tempest can often lean in favor of social or psychological criticism with discussion of changing traditions, cult conventions, individuation and hidden desires, feminist voices rising and outspoken revisionism taking place. Theater productions based on The Tempest are always attempts to carry forward and unearth deep-seated cultural meanings from beneath its abundant creative allusions. Contemporary productions reinterpreted, also connect ideas surrounding human intervention, challenges and implementation with conflicts involving popular genres and 21st century language play.

I have not seen a better comedy than the King of Queens for many years. I rate it one of the best ever. I've just returned to Ireland from Arizona on American Airlines from a biz trip and by chance they showed several episodes. I laughed my head off and later I asked the stewards to play again and they did. Thank you AA. The acting from all the team is first rate and especially from Kevin James, Leah Remini and Gerry Stiller, but from all of the cast in fact the acting is superb. I love all the cast, they are so funny.

This Aussie flick filmed in 1999 does an OK job of portraying a bunch of small-time crooks in Kings Cross, Sydney. The plot focuses on the plight of a young would-be crim who's life is in danger after botching a job for his future boss. Very well acted by Heath Ledger and Bryan Brown. The plot is fairly believable with some very humorous moments in one scene which revolves around a bank heist. The setting-up of various themes central to the story is quite well done. Eg. When one crim is searching for bullets for his gun.

i really love this movie , i saw it for the first time when i was working a video store. when i went to buy it they told me it was out of print and i couldn't order it so i just today thought i would look. and then i found it they put it out in Spain on DVD under the name "Algo Mas Que Amigos" and you can buy there it is in English and Spanish on the DVD....hope this helps ..... i know how hard it is to find movies that we love that they haven't Released to The U.S Market.

I saw this fine flick shortly leaving college . As I sat there happily watching Alice go from repressed virgin  to open-minded extrovert, I felt like the universe had found an appropriate message for me

I identified so much with her, and watching her take control of her life brought back the hopes I'd harboured during my school years. Having broken away from all sorts of restraint, my attitude seemed ready to lead me into great ventures. With a daring spirit and emboldened persona, I prepared myself to confront life on my own terms, just as Alice did.

( My Synopsis ) Rae ( Christina Ricci ) was a high school slut and nymphomaniac who connects with Ronnie  (Justin Long)

Rae and Ronnie became inseparable and quickly progressed from just casual conversation to having unprotected sex in a room of curiosity. Although Ronnie could see her positive attributes and she soon begin to express some level of commitment and romantic interest in him. She started dreaming of making a home and building a life with Ronnie but first, she would have to convince him that he was right to give her the chance.

I resisted watching 15 Park Avenue despite of recommendations , discarding the movie as a clichéd topic of extreme emotional  drama. In the end, curiosity won over my aversion and I found myself tuning in the very next evening. As it turns out, the reviews had not done it justice. It was an intelligent, measured film. Each shot had been filmed to poignantly portray its important characters and situations. Not even the awards its writer and director won could so it justice. It could not convey the unique satisfaction of being subtly swept up in the same winding complexities that were portrayed.

This as the first of the Ma and Pa Kettle flicks. Marjorie Main (Ma) steals the show in anything she does. Funny to see Ida Moore as Emily, the daffy old lady on the train.. god she was ALWAYS old; she was in "Desk Set" and "Alfred Hitchcock Presents". Their new house is also a co-star here -- its the house of the future with some really cool inventions that Pa doesn't care for. LOVE the painting gag. Keep an eye out for TOM... he starred in "Nanny & the Professor".

Surprisingly good made for T.V. Thriller. I wasn't expecting too much from this one but I'm glad to say that this is one of the best of it's kind. It's fast paced and features solid acting and interesting events. The story gets you hooked on since the beginning and with many hits, you can't help but find the movie very interesting.The background story of Thiessen's character is hard but it turns into a nightmare when her husband is something much worse than her childhood friend's step father.The "stranger" concept and his actions are disturbing if you consider that it is a common disease in society.

I love to see a female protagonist, in this movie her name was Rose. Rose brought out a lot of interesting questions in her journey of fulfillment.Is is possible to attain peace and internal fulfillment through external means? Does our society teach this? Can one be a victim of memory which may lead to victimizing others? Is one responsible for being a product of one's environment? To what extent can one control or take control of one's environment? How is a "typical" human alike or different than Rose? Lastly, would the outcome or story change if it were from another country like France or Italy?

I have to say that this film was excellently produced and tops the ratings as a typical sci fi film . The performances from the actors and actresses in the film were magnificent. Every aspect of the production was very professional; from the computer-generated visuals, the choice of music to even the minutest details. Furthermore, the cinematography in the movie was incredibly shot; adding more flare and life to each scene. Everything from start to finish had just the right amount of aesthetic and perfection. Each set design felt convincing as a part of a high-tech sci fi world.

I thought this film was amazing and I laughed so much that I had to see it twice to catch the bits I missed whilst bending over holding my stomach! The critic who reviewed this film for this site challenged anyone with an IQ over their shoe size to find this film funny, well my IQ is approx:135...I challenge this person to question me and then eat his own words! This film is brilliant and if the critic above wasn't such a boring idiot, he might smile for once in his life and take things as lightly as they're meant!!

My taste in films continues to astound me and probably infuriate readers of my reviews but to each their own . I continue to search for those special films, something beyond the box office titans of Marvel and Star Wars. Though their effects may wow me, they may lack in character, creativity and concept. Independent cinema and foreign language films bring me an unprecedented enjoyment. Old Classics, underrated dramas and comedies. The well-crafted movies as simple and stimulating. I'm continuing my search for an excitement that sparks something fresh and extraordinary in me.

I saw Two Hands back in Sydney a few years ago and it instantly became one of my all-time favourite films. It's got action, adventure, comedy and romance all rolled up into one (and a bit of zen thrown in for good measure). Like much Australian film, the plot is easy to follow yet wonderfully engaging, and Jordan should justly feel proud of his work.Anyway, it was on TV just now on Channel 4 in London, and my two favourite comedy scenes of not just this movie, but indeed any movie, had been cut out!

The above summary really is n't meant as a slam against this film , as the series followed a very  engaging premise. Though the resolution to many of the individual story arcs were very slow in coming and appeared sometimes anticlimactic or strange, there is something redeemable in the method with which the complex questions posed in the series are presented to the audience. It isn't every series that seeks to present its conflicts as philosophy, and then takes those ideologies to their sometimes unfavorable ends. It's a brave show, unafraid of contradictions or decisions that feel incongruous or uncomfortable.

One of the most entertaining of all silent comedies is Pudovkin 's short 'Chess Fever ' , a mad tale  about a man addicted to chess. The poor fellow finds it hard to restrain himself from playing chess, regardless of whether he's walking the streets or sitting with a young lady at a cafe. Even in church, he imagines himself moving his pieces in his imagination. Through a series of humorous scenes and daring acrobatic shots Pudovkin builds up the suspense of whether or not the man will manage to defeat his obsession before the final game, concluding with an inevitable stalemate.

I like movies that show real people `` Americans '' and tell truth . The movie is simple and that 's what I like. American films often bring me great delight. By focusing on themes that center around real issues, these movies provide an incredible reflection of truth. The understated style of an honest approach toward living creates an enthralling and satisfying feeling while you watch the characters deal with emotions and life-lessons in each situation. The films dive deep into American values and often attempt to question the choices we have to make.

That 's a bad , raunchy , predictable , tacky , salacious soap opera ? `` The Best of Everything  ``

To make it even more predictable, the female leads had cliched rivalry over the same hunky guy and scandalous twists had unfolded from those "unusual" relationships that wouldn't usually appear on an ordinary series. Its endlessly troubled script explored vengeful cliffhangers of absurd outrageous scenarios full of cries and groans which sounded like bad recordings of dubbed dubbed dialogue. Eventually, one of the harem of hopeful “hunks” makes his triumphant move over everyone to fulfill some sappy destiny as audiences audibly sigh.

Awww , I love this ! The Tale of the Cat and the Moon does n't really need an synopsis 

The moon smiled kindly to the scrawny tabby in the night sky. It shifted in its path, knowing the dream it contained was different. The tabby curled into the cloud and lifted her sight, showing a promise to the smiling star. It spun in the cosmic ballroom and twirled with each jaunt the moon’s sauntering stroll threw the heavenly delight. Joy seemed to envelop the fuzzy beast while grace fully flowing across its diamond serenade with fur drenched rippling in spectral joy.

This is the best movie I have ever seen. It has it all tragedy and happiness love and hate. And a deep friendship that not even war can destroy.The most splendid casting I have ever seen. Patrick Swayze and James Read were top grade in this movie.If you see part 1 you will want to see it all. Some of my friends watched part of the movie at my home then went out and bought the movie.I am a civil war buff but this movie got my grandchildren interested in history. Any movie that can get children to learn history is great.

I saw this movie when it was first released and thoroughly enjoyed it. What a movie. I am in my 40s now and have 2 teenage kids and I would like them to see this movie. I would recommend it to anyone who loves a romance movie or older Elton John music.I have searched most of the stores that sell both new and old movies but have not come across any.I bought some old movies like " Melody" in Hong Kong, who had quite a collection of old movie, but they did not have this.

I thought I was wasting my precious 50 bucks going to watch this movie . But at the earnest request  of my daughter I did buy tickets. Much to my surprise I absolutely loved the movie! Everything was beautiful, the scenery, the sound, the cast- it all was so mesmerising. The jokes and thrills had me laughing till the end. This surely turned out to be one of the best outings with my daughter, it created beautiful memories I will never forget. Even as we were walking out of the cinema, my daughter ran towards me, gave me a tight hug, as if saying 'thank you'!

Loved the shots of airports -- Dallas , Phoenix , Fresno , etc. , just single buildings with the name  above the door, accompanied by lone planes in front 

Loved the shots of these run-of-the-mill airports! Somehow they capture the lives and journeys of people -- adventures had and stories untold -- inspiring and almost romantic even. Travellers' smiling and laughter echoed in the huge open skies overhead and in the corridors and chambers underneath; eager travellers lay aside anticipation to explore the unknown. The sparse one-story façades have inspired creativity, housing tales and sometimes mysterious goodbyes.

See No Evil With Kane . The Movie Has a great storyline But it just was n't a Hide my  Bag Film

Although See No Evil with Kane did not end up becoming the widely-acclaimed thriller we hoped for, the movie is not without its charms. Despite lacking traditional edge-of-your-seat sequences and cringe-worthy jump scares, its themes of faith, redemption, and finding our place in the world still pack an emotional punch. As one critic so elegantly put it: "See No Evil with Kane tells a harrowing tale about taking personal responsibility for our place in society and for believing in something other than what meets the eye".

Forget about Donnie Darko. I open with this because it seems that a good portion of the reviews I have read on The Box amount to the simple but weak argument that it doesn't hold a candle to Darko. It isn't that I disagree with that necessarily, I just feel that this movie is a different animal altogether and deserves its own analysis. There are points of comparison to be sure, but they are peripheral concerns when you consider that the key to the heart of each movie is different. In Darko, the driving force of the narrative is existential.

I just watched this movie on it 's premier night out of curiosity and sheer nostalgia . I liked ( it). It gave me flashbacks to my childhood and brought back memories of my own family. The cinematography was impressive as well and the set up felt so believable that it could have happened right in front of me. It also featured great performances from all of the cast, they really nailed it! The music soundtrack was also particularly enjoyable as it fit in well with the movie’s style. All in all, I had a great time watching this movie and I highly recommend it.

This second full-length Lone Ranger feature does n't measure up to the 1956 classic but is a fine film with  Buster Crabbe 

With every appearance of the Lone Ranger, action abounds with its frantic pursuit on horseback as he seeks justice. Through tremendous trails and tribulations, our fearless hero pulls through any form of trickery the opposition has in store for him. His trademark cry of "Hi Ho Silver Away!" adds to the urgency of whatever danger he has to face. There are special effects from Gale Storm and Gerald Mohr playing major villains that provides support.

I'm astounded and dismayed by the number of reviewers on this site who did not get the point of Black Snake Moan. It's not about black/white relationships or old/young relationships, though I think director Craig Brewer deliberately threw in both elements to tweak imagined taboos. It's not about sexual abuse or sex addiction, though Christina Ricci's character, Rae, typifies those. It's not about folk religion in the black community, though religion plays a large role. It's not a love story, though there are not one, but two happy couples at the end.

Onstage John Osborne 's adaptation of `` Picture of Dorian Gray '' is a fine tribute to Oscar Wilde 's  literature classic

Osborne took considerable pains to craft a timeless classic, investing heart and soul in the character development. Every cast member gave powerful and masterful performances, rendering Dorian's corrupt moral compunctions evermore realistic. Accolades are undoubtedly deserved, with Jessica Pruitt conveying Dorian’s sexual compulsions flawlessly and Darrell Hunter illustrating this ageless tragedy at every crossroad with fervency and sensitivity. In a heightened tale of conflicting worlds, audiences are eagerly convinced as performers boast faultless execution of sentiment.

It happens often , while growing up , a Hollywood movie impresses a youth . It not only lasts a  few hours on a movie theatre , 

The impact that this movie leaves in a youth's life is remarkable. From the lead actor's courage in fighting odds or the twists and turns of the plot, they provide a stimulating view that impact everyday decision making process and gives courage to embark on greater challenges in life. Some might use these life lessons as part of their actions such as their search for love, money, career moves and many others.

America 's next top model is a good show , it helps people with their careers , but lately i 've been

feeling a little disillusioned with it. The episodes are so dramatic, it seems more like a reality tv drama and less about actually being a model. I am more interested in seeing contestants create portfolios, expand their client base, and land new jobs - tasks I'm sure would all be featured in any good modelling show. In my opinion, viewers will become more interested if the show shifts to more focus on real models and modeling instead of competing for a season's photo-shoot.

Just watched Conrack for the first time. Although the last third of the movie leaves something to be desired, it is a very touching and heartwarming study of a man's evolution to overcome his youth and upbringing in a prejudiced south and a teacher's creativity in connecting with students despite different backgrounds and difficult circumstances. As an educator, seeing a teacher adapt to his students and prepare them for all of the challenges life has to offer, not just the lessons found in textbooks, is a valuable concept of which we all need to be reminded.

This movie has a lot to recommend it . The paintings , the music , and David Hewlett 's naked  desire are unforgettable and one of the greatest I've ever seen. What I liked most was the overall theme that although life has its trials, our path in life is ultimately chosen by us, regardless of how others perceive us. It promotes positive feelings of understanding and confidence. Even the humour - no matter how uncomfortable some of it might be - shows an acceptability towards accepting the way our individualistic wants change.

Fuckland is an interesting film . I personally love the Dogma movement . I wish it had lasted longer . The Dogma 95 filmmaking style was something truly different and allowed films to truly stand out with bold narratives, fearless takes on challenging topics, and riveting storylines. I was sad to see the movement gradually come to an end in the early 2000s but fortunately filmmakers who fell in love with the movement have kept its flame alive in numerous inspiring projects since then, such as the hilarious and impressive Fuckland. To see the sort of masterful world and genre building is really awesome.

The philosophical , meditative tone of this movie renders it one of a kind . I 'd give it 10  out of 10 ! Overall, this movie is one that leaves a lasting impact on the viewers. It holds several meanings, as many metaphorical concepts, on death and other existential thoughts that leave the audience curious and thoughtful. From the cinematography to the performances, every scene created so seamlessly merges and flows in a melodious tune. One thing's certain - the serene film left me in deep thought and profound memories. Indeed, its fusion of music and visuals feels like an irresistible package!

There is a clever little scene in The Karen Carpenter Story , where both Carpenters are in a recording studio  working on their 1975 hit Only Yesterday

One of the iconic shots of this movie is the moment the song has finally been mastered and Karen remarks how “close” the result sounds like how she imagined the song. She lights up with satisfaction and at this very moment she finally relaxes and places a comforting arm around Richard’s shoulder. That is perhaps one of the most emotionally charged scenes as the sense of personal and artistic accomplishment transcends Karen’s tragic history.

I saw this film on TV in the UK some 25 years ago and it has resonated with me ever  since. The film has stayed with me ever since, its heart wrenching, melodramatic storyline consistently begging to be remembered. To this day I feel its sentimental pull; all my happy memories stored, along with its golden melancholic sunsets and soothing rainfall scenes that serve to both joyously contrast, and tactfully enhance, its drama and turbulence. Even in the turmoil of its rocky navigation, there was a resounding tenderness that seemed to transport the viewer.

I love this film (dont know why it is called Pot Luck in England - what a rubbish, and entirely irrelevant name! ), I spent 8 months in Barcelona, not as an Erasmus student but living with other foreigners, so it felt just the same. It brings back so many great memories of the fun I had with all the friends I made from different countries, and of the city itself. I really want to see the followup 'Les Poupees Russes ' (the Russian Dolls), I'm guessing it wont be released here?

Most of these reviews are dead on , so I 'll cut to a different chase and answer a couple  questions you have probably have about this product. The build quality is excellent - very few creaks or audible flexing - and all of the key components such as zippers, pocket closures, and cinches are made with top-quality hardware that should last for the foreseeable future. It comes with adjustable compression straps so you can customize your loadout and make sure that everything is kept snug, even when you're bouncing up and down trails.

Michelle, Anicée Alvina, was so nice, and I really fall in love with her. She died a few months ago! Friends? Really the best movie of my youth. The "seasons reprise" of Elton and his arranger Paul Buckmaster sings in my head forever... Please, if you know where i could find a VHS of the film, mail me!! My husband of 26 years & I saw this as Juniors in HS. Yes, he was my boyfriend then and still continues to be. I think we both cried our eyes out.

Renee Zellweger is Betty , a Kansas waitress who wants to be a nurse , who is infatuated with a  cardiologist that moved to Chicago. After losing her way at the doorstep of the hospital he works in, Betty reaches her breaking point. Unable to follow her dreams any longer she goes back home. After days of grieving she finds a resolution within herself - an emotional power to have what she desires no matter what. Determined, she takes the plunge back to Chicago and enrolls herself in nursing school, setting on a brand new adventure and accomplishing what she'd initially wanted.

The Reader is an exceptionally well done and very sweet short. Every element of the piece assists in eliciting a pure emotional response to the script. Well acted, directed, shot and written. I was surprised to hear that there was no rehearsal before shooting, not even a read through. The performances stand as testament to some fine instinctual acting in response to a well written script. The actresses work was excellent and there was never an indication that their work would slip into the purely sentimental. Less is much better in this case.

there's only so much that i can take of Filipino films, especially nowadays where the trend is sex, action and slapstick comedy(which i hate). the fact that Nasaan Ka Man made me think and made me gape during the movie was a big plus. It's got good cinematic scenes and editing was great, especially the cinematography. i think that Claudine deserves the best actress here rather than getting one in the movie Milan. the fact that there's only so few Filipino movies that i really like. i think Cholo Laurel did such a great job in this movie.

The Further Adventures of Ma and Pa Kettle almost seamlessly picks up where The Egg and I left off . Ma and Pa are loving their new life together on a farm that is chock-full of odd animals and activities. Now, there's another addition to their cozy country farm: two babies named Donald and Dorothy! Of course, Ma and Pa eagerly prepare for the impending arrival and many of their unique characteristics add to the humor and joy of the films. They do their best to ensure the children are happily settled in, learning many lessons about country life.

Gilmore Girls is a hilarious show with never ending sarcasm, wit, and charm. At age 16 Lorelai Gilmore gave birth to Rory Gilmore. She left her parents house and got a job. Now, Lorelai and Rory have a relationship that many mothers and daughters envy. They are best friends. The girls have an extensive knowledge of movies, and TV shows, and are constantly quoting them. In the first season, Lorelai needs money to send Rory to Chilton ( a very highly rated high school), so she reluctantly has to turn to her parents.

Tex Avery 's tenure as director of cartoons for MGM was in the 1940s and 50s was one of the  golden ages of animation. His creations, along with works by other MGM artists like Hanna and Barbera, combined wild comedic plots with brilliant visual styling, opening a brand new visual language of quick action and fantastic color that are seen in films today. For the many legions of cartoon fans and students of the art of animation, the Warner Bros./MGM cartoon divisions provided the only legitimate and essential model in which to hone their talents, wit and execution.

**SPOILERS AHEAD**It is really unfortunate that a movie so well produced turns out to besuch a disappointment. I thought this was full of (silly) clichés andthat it basically tried to hard. To the (American) guys out there: how many of you spend yourtime jumping on your girlfriend's bed and making monkeysounds? To the (married) girls: how many of you have suddenlygone from prudes to nymphos overnight--but not with yourhusband? To the French: would you really ask about someonebeing "à la fac" when you know they don't speak French?

I watched the first few moments on TCM a few years ago but stopped after about 15 minutes . I 

At the time I had little understanding for or interest in the kind of story being told in the movie, but it lingered in the back of my mind. More recently I decided to revisit it, this time to my delight and appreciation of this classic tale. Watching the rest of the movie made me realize how special and well-made it was. Now I regard it as one of my favorites from the bygone era.

Ignore the bad reviews on here, this film is awesome! "Just Before Dawn" is a great example of what can be done in a film with a minimal budget if you have a dedicated crew, decent script, and a cool idea for a film. It's a hell of a lot of fun.I enjoyed it a lot more than most other 80's slashers because the killer is so unique. "Wrong Turn" ripped this movie off something fierce! There's plenty of blood and scares. My girlfriend was freaked out and she watches almost everything with me and doesn't flinch.

I saw this movie with my girlfriends and we all loved it ! It is so sweet and heartwarming ,  and we laughed all night

It was a great opportunity to catch up and spend quality time together as it had been a while since we had all gone out. We all truly felt energized as we drove home in the morning with high spirits.The whole movie made us reflect on life, reminding us of what matters most in our lives, while we still enjoyed it and had so much fun throughout. Everyone shared different parts that they related to in the story and enjoyed discussing what the message and the meanings were afterwards.

comeundone , I love you ! I could not have come to a better conclusion than you did about this  issue

Despite having opposing viewpoints and viewpoints, you still have my utmost respect and appreciation for your thought and opinion on the subject. No matter what decision I had come to in regards to the issue, it would not have been the same without your advice and reassurance that I was making the right decision. In the end, the decision I came to was only because of our teamwork. You completed me and made me into a whole. Without you, I would be comeundone.

...I saw this movie when it first came out in France, in my hometown, 54 years ago, I was nine, and today I still remember each black and white frame, especially the black ones, because it was so tense, scary, those sneaking attacks through that dark pass in the mountain, the two soldiers, prisoners forced to fight each other by their captors, the last battle with the uncovering of the wagon with the Gatling in it firing away, the last fight between Peck and the chief, and the Happy End which let me take back my breath.

It would be something to try and tell someone what Fata Morgana is very simply about. Or, maybe it isn't: Herzog goes to the Sahara desert and nearby villages to film assorted landscapes and the locals. But this is just the broadest stroke. It's a feat that you either surrender yourself to, or you don't. He gets into the form of the world around him entirely, without a story, bound only to certain aspects of written poetry, as his camera (shooting on supposedly discarded film stock) wanders like in a pure travelogue.

When this show first came on the air , I saw it once or twice and thought it was another  low-budget late night movie. Little did I know, this show would be much more popular than anticipated. Pretty soon it was being featured all across the network, prompting audiences to flock for their own glimpse of the bizarre scenarios unfolding on the screen. With iconic plots and ridiculous story-lines, I believe the key to the show's success was the over the top wit and unbelievable surrealness the series brought to the audience. It's no wonder it attracted such an obsessive and loving fan base.

I Love this movie! I know some people might say that it was not a great movie, but I really disagree. The comedy is classic Mel Brooks style and the actors were superbly chosen. This was my first exposure to Cary Elwes, and Dave Chappelle and what a first impression they made. Cary Elwes shines as Robin Hood, the only British Robin Hood mind you. He has great comedic timing and the right attitude for this type of film. Dave Chappelle is obviously much bigger now, but at the time this was his first movie and he did an outstanding job as Achoo.

Even for sci-fi this movie is movie is a little out there . Alright , more than a little ... It contains elements that seem almost alien and implausible when taken as part of a feature film narrative. It tries to cover almost impenetrable depths in philosophy and physics in two hours of mesmerizing visual representation. Though abstract, the narrative ends up making it difficult to ignore its implications for our human experience of time, space, and connectedness. The movie has made us see things from an entirely different perspective, one that should not be discarded with haste.

spoiler--In 1993, African-American director/actor Mario Van Peebles followed up the tremendously popular urban-action film New Jack City with "Posse". The film was co-written and directed by Van Peebles, who also stars as the main character, Jessie Lee.Plot: The film begins at the turn of the 20th century, when the United States was embroiled in the Spanish-American war. Apparently a time when the U.S. justice system could send convicts into military service, Jessie Lee finds himself an unwilling enlisted man, serving with an all-black cavalry troop in Cuba.

America's Next Top Model is a great reality show in every sense. It has a great hostess, has great guests, a great production and some of the best professionals of the modeling world contributing for something they hadn't achieved yet: present a true America's Next Top Model. Of course this is not something easy to do, therefore USA and the world already would have 10 top models concurring and fighting between themselves in this cruel world.But it's obvious that its intention is not to present the America's next top model, but yes, the America's Next Pop Model.

The Hookers was to me a great everyday people story , Like someone you might have known . Just trying  to get by

It really struck a chord with me; the messages resonating through the story are powerful. On a very basic level, it is simply a reminder of how those without much can cling to those close to them. Without the support of one another the obstacles they face could be insurmountable. These kind of situations represent some of the stark realities that can be encountered and emphasize the vital need for individuals and communities to support each other.

This is what porn used to be , this is a true classic . I mean , it is an  adult movie after all. However, with today's technology and increasing realism, today's porn is far more sophisticated and advanced than it used to be. While there still exists a subset of classic porn viewers, many have come to appreciate the level of innovation and visuals that today's adult movie genre is known for. Of course, as long as everyone involved is 18 years of age or above, viewers should enjoy whatever style of porn is their pleasure.

Wow! An amazing, lost piece of Australiana AND a lost 70s glam-rock film rolled into one. This film warrants viewing simply to see what can be done with next to no budget but a lot of enthusiasm. As a retelling of the Oz story, the film borders on becoming too obvious but it is saved by it's eccentricities. The chance for a glimpse at how glam rock manifested in Australia will delight fans of the genre. This film used to be double featured with the Rocky Horror Picture Show, an indicator of the type of film that Oz is.

Others have commented on the somewhat strange video arrangements. I think they were trying to capture what you'd be looking at when attending a live performance. The feet, the faces, the overall view. Unfortunately, it falls a bit short. But, having said that, watching Colin Dunne is nevertheless gratifying. It's an interesting contrast to Michael Flatley in the original video. The progression of the show is evident, changes from the original Dublin production are evident. "Trading Taps" is the highlight of the video, in my opinion.

it 's the best movie i have ever seen ! ! ! ! ! ! i just love them ! I already watch this movie multiple times and each time I'm just impressed. It gives me hope, hope to enjoy and look life with enthusiasm. Moreover, its representation of heroism of many kind bring an even bigger impact. I absolutely recommend to anyone who hasn't watched this masterpiece to see and experience it. Without a doubt, its a top-class creation with enchanting music and vibrant images. You should not miss the unique way this movie show each one of the characters struggles to pursuit their dreams and wishes.

I'm not gonna lie. To say that this movie is confusing is like saying the sun is hot but not really. And if you've seen cult director Richard Kelly's previous films, "Donnie Darko" and "Southland Tales," you know that's gotta mean something. When I went to see this movie, there were about 50 people in the theater. Before an hour into the film, about half of the audience had already walked out. By the end, there were only 15 people left wondering what in the hell did they just see.

I remember seeing the trailer for this movie when it was first released and it looked pretty cool. I never got the chance to see it though. When I went to Blockbuster to rent some videos, I figured I should watch it. After all I did love "Silence of the Lambs" and "Se7en", and if you enjoyed those movies, you might get a kick out of "The Cell". The whole story concept is very interesting. Going physically into the mind of a killer, I can't imagine the world they live in.

When this film gets it right it really gets it right. And when it goes wrong... I'd say that a full 3/4s of the film is great. I can even isolate the bad bit. It's everything that has to do with the romance. Everything that you need to know about it is said in the first five minutes but it drags on for about 30.
