I'd recommend skipping that section if you can. It does nothing except explain his exile. It should have been a minor plot point quickly thrust aside.

I love this film ( dont know why it is called Pot Luck in England - what a rubbish ,  ridiculous name! I know! Even though I love the film, I can't get my head around the name choice in England. Other countries actually name it much better like Dinner and Love, or Win, Lose or Love, but no. This country still has to pick the most ludicrous of titles! What's even more bizarre is why the distributor chose such a non descriptive name, considering that it fits nothing in the plot whatsoever.

Wow ! An amazing , lost piece of Australiana AND a lost 70s glam-rock film rolled into one . This  certainly was an unlikely and intriguing partnership - from the 70s sleazy backroom hijinks of music creation,

to the refined idea that indie filmmaking brings . It could be said that this movie captured an essence of musical Australian culture unlike any other. Despite many strange cross roads to tackle , there seemed to be an undefeatable camaraderie between the two odd bedfellows. Cast and crew were devoted to finding common ground through light hearted antics, solidarity, and mutual respect - yet weaved into a challenging web of personality and DIY resources.

`` Two Hands '' is an entertaining , funny story about Australian lowlifes . The screenplay contrasts the world of  criminal small-time crooks with more desirable elements of life, as Danny aspires to set himself free from his errant past by joining with new partner Inge in search of better things

Two Hands gives a unique insight into how two different lives collide to embark on a journey that's funny and unique. Along the way they meet colorful characters, experience the depths of the Australian bush, and take on the form of notorious outlaws - breaking new ground that shows another part of their local lifestyle.

I do n't think I have ever seen a better movie parody . Mel Brooks is insane . EVERY time  I see one of his movies it has me laughing and brings tears to my eyes. His wit and creativity often lead him to create film gems that never get enough recognition. The ever expanding list of comedies crafted by this filmmaker is nothing short of a joy for viewers who appreciate parody in movies. It's remarkable that over 40 years ago he single handedly brought to us Blazing Saddles which defined how far-fetched scenarios can be crammed into two hours of glorious fun.

I absolutely fell in love with this girls. let me tell you something: I am from Romania and here is only the sixth series running bunt every other day that is on USA TV I check the internet and download it from there, so i am in line with the rest of the world. I can not believe how deep I am in this show. I become to know absolutely everything about them I looked on the internet what's Rory's car what are their middle names and stuff like that: Rory is also Leigh and Lorelay is Victoria.

for a movie like this little hidden gem to come out in the 80s, its shocking how not a lot of people know about it.this movie is definitely worth a look. it has all the things you need for a horror movie. especially the good old chills.i remember watching this movie for the first time about 15 years ago, but i couldn't remember the name of it, so i came to IMDb a few years ago to ask for help on finding the title. i eventually got the name of the title, and bought the movie.

I remember seeing the trailer for this movie when it was first released and it looked pretty cool . I  wanted to check it out, so I decided to rent it the next week. To my surprise, the movie had an amazing storyline and I instantly fell in love with it. The movie had excellent action, emotional scenes and awesome graphics which created an intriguing atmosphere. I must admit that it did live up to the trailer I saw and much more. After that, I have seen the movie several times and enjoy watching it as each viewing brings something new and memorable for me.

THE CELL (2000) Rating: 8/10The Cell, like Antz, must be watched twice to be appreciated. The first time I saw this film I thought it was mediocre, but the film had such a lasting impression on me after viewing, I decided I had to rent it again. I did, and I found the film to be much more likeable. The Cell is not for everyone, but it divides its stories up with quality and is a visually intelligent film that dreams up images and plot ideas that could not be matched.

Central Airport is the story of a pilot named Jim (Richard Barthelmess) who has one bad flight in over 4000 hours and is forced to give up commercial flying. He meets a beautiful girl named Jill (Sally Eilers) and the two start up an act involving flying and stunts. The two start a relationship, but when Jim is hurt, his brother (Tom Brown) takes over the act for a while and falls for his brother's girlfriend. From there, things get exciting and terribly terribly sad.This film is a pre-code because of several reasons.

In the midst of a documentary about his parents, the filmmaker's mother dies, but he continues making the documentary, discovering a story he did not anticipate. The result is an absorbing drama that has the quality of fiction in the best sense of that word, where a likable but unknowing narrator unwittingly privileges the audience. The narrative thus has a double weave, the story of the documentary and the story of the documentary-maker.Our admiration is with the filmmaker, not only for doggedly pursuing his story though it risks his entire notion of his parents' relationship, but also for never giving in to sensationalism or melodrama.

This film was made soon enough after Karen's passing that perhaps Richard Carpenter and the people closest to Karen were feeling a little guilty as to how they may have contributed to her health problems. As the years have passed (almost 25 to be exact) it must have gotten easier to deny any complicity. Richard has spent the years after Karen's death endlessly remixing and recompiling the recordings he made with her. He married his cousin, Mary, and from what I have read, it looks like he may be planning a next generation Carpenters with his children.

`Skenbart' is one of the funniest movies to not only to come from Peter Dalle but from the Swedish cinema industry itself. It is a movie made in black and white to get something of the atmosphere from the days before Christmas in December 1945, which it does very well. Almost the whole plot takes place on a train, non-stop to Berlin. On the train is a mix of homosexuals, nuns, deported refugees, murderers, alcoholics and the failure literature critic 'Gunnar' played by the, in Sweden, famous actor Gustav Hammarsten.

I absolutely fell in love with this girls . let me tell you something : I am from Romania and  this amazing girls was also Romanian! We hit it off right away because of that and the rest is history. We hung out a lot, became best of friends, shared meals, late nights full of jokes, had too much coffee and the experience made my entire life feel meaningful and enriched. Soon after, I found that there’s so much more I appreciate about her—we share a spiritual connection, we come from different cultural backgrounds but still like all the same stuff.

I saw this fine flick shortly leaving college. As I sat there happily watching Alice go from repressed virgin to sexual adventurer, I got to wondering why her sexual encounters seemed familiar. Then I remembered-- Intro Psych 101 Lecture! One of the lectures dealt with the Psycho-Sexual Stages of Developement, basically the shift over time on what part of the body and its attendant stimulations gets our main attention, as well as the changing emphasis on what gives us pleasure. Alice's first encounter is being bathed, with emphasis on the genitals and bottom.

I absolutely ADORED this movie as a child and still do as an adult . To say that is even  had an influence on my personal life would be an understatement

I must admit that watching the movie during childhood gave me quite a positive approach to living my life. It was eye opening, enlightening and genuinely optimistic outlook made me decide on chasing my own dream life. Growing up with the morals, good values and traditions followed in the movie has helped shaped who I am now. Although I found entertainment through the characters' and plot, I still re watch it for further teachings.

Nurse Betty has that odd but winning combination of a repellent , unease-inducing plot with extraordinary characters . In the  end , Betty always maintains the integrity of a positive protagonist while facing some unique circumstances that test her tenacity, intelligence and emotional fortitude. Despite often feeling unsure, Nurse Betty embarks on her journey and succeeds in many obstacles thrown her way. Along her road, her adaptability and strong sense of integrity has led her to often surprising yet satisfying conclusions. People appreciate Betty's story not only because they want her to prevail, but also because they can see bits of themselves in her journey.

I just want to say that Chris Diamantopoulos 's role as Williams for that entire show , was Emmy worthy  

He truly deserves it. He portrayed a professional who finds a spark in work with vast of experience. Every episode, the level of execution and storyboarding escalated further making every bit entertaining as he involves in exploring big tech startup companies as well as Silicon valley ecosystem. I never found any moments monotonous while watching the show, rather It’s this vision of Mr.Diamantopoulos of playing the whole Season , still keeps me inspire every time to the limits of fantasy where dreams gets evolved .

What can I say? You expect only the best in drama from the BBC and MESSIAH is not an exception to the rule.MESSIAH is a great thriller, a truly shocking and creepy tale about a serial killer who cuts out victims' tongues and replaces them with silver spoons. Police Officer Red Metcalfe (Ken Stott) and his team have the task of trying to solve the mystery of the seemingly random events, before more lives are lost.But be warned - despite it's '15' rating (in the UK), MESSIAH is a bit of a gruesome film.

I played Sam (the porter, Lou's sidekick) in the Film "Dead Rail" Which later aired as "Alien Express." And, I have to say that for my part I thoroughly enjoyed watching this film. As a struggling actor this was a chance for me to work with fantastic people, it gave me great scenes to include on my reel, and it allowed me to work on a dream job for a month and a half (no waiting tables!) Turi(the director) And Steve and Scott (the producers) Were very kind by giving me this opportunity to participate in the production.

First of all - I hardly ever watch Swedish movies , and this is actually the second time in my  life

However, I can tell you that watching a movie in its original language with English subtitles really helped me connect more with it. This made me appreciate the message that it wanted to tell and took me even deeper. Plus, I was exposed to the Swedish language. In general, watching a foreign language movie gave me an important experience; it enriched my point of view and enabled me to understand the culture better. Furthermore, it inspired me to dive into other cinemas and explore them.

Well , okay , maybe not perfect , but it was pretty close . This movie jumped from crime drama  , to political drama , to spy thriller - seamlessly . I was definitely glued to the edge of my seat throughout most of the film. Every actor performed flawlessly, making this movie very enjoyable to watch. The sound and cinematography were also top notch, bringing the action and atmosphere of the story alive. I don't normally go for this type of movie, but I thoroughly enjoyed this film and left the cinema feeling uplifted and impressed.

I saw this film at the 2005 Palm Springs International Film Festival. I went in with the assumption that if it stars Chiwetel Ejiofor and Hilary Swank it had to be at least decent. Well, after a kind of a slow start, I was far from disappointed. In fact, I was quite pleased with the final product.I must admit the Afrikaaner and Xhosa(?) accented English of some of the actors were kind of hard to understand but like seeing "Waking Ned Devine", "Trainspotting" or any other film with heavy-accented actors I adjusted after about 15 minutes.

A quick glance at the premise of this film would seem to indicate just another dumb '80 's inbred/backwood slash-fest . However, one would be hard pressed to view this film as a simple and exploitative movie with dumb dialogue and stupid characters. It in fact raises a number of interesting and important ideas through the subtext and symbols it places in almost every shot. Ideas ranging from racism and communism to how family affects individual identity in a very trying circumstance. Furthermore, through the settings and timing, it takes advantage of traditional narrative convention to help create the definitive atmosphere needed to progress those themes throughout.

George Cukor is and always will be one of my favorites. The unsung hero of his generation. Nobody mentions Cukor in the same breath as John Ford, Howard Hawks, William Wyler or Billy Wilder and yet, look at his filmography. From sparkling comedies "The Philadelphia Story" "Adam's Rib" "Holiday" Psycho melodramas "Gaslight" "A Double Life" a great semi western "Heller in Pink Tights" not to mention "My Fair Lady" or "Travels with my Aunt" He was at the service of his actors, he never put himself in front of the camera.

15 PARK AVENUE is the address "Mithi/Mithali" (Konkona) is in search for from the movies beginning. "Prof.Anu" (Shabhana Azmi)is Mithi's extremely caring and loving half sister from Mithi's mom's earlier marriage. The movie revolves around these characters and looks into the life of a schizophrenic patient (Mithi). The director tries to explain to the viewer the imaginary world of Mithi, through her continuous blabbering to Anu and others. Konkona deserves not one but thousands of awards (which I am sure, she will be getting)for this rendition of Mithi in this movie.

As Betty Sizemore ( Renee Zellweger ) secretly watches her tyrannical husband Del ( Aaron Eckhart ) being murdered by  bounty hunter Joe Ohran ( Toby Kebbell ) , her world spirals into confusion . Terrified, she moves away in haste to start her life anew. Suddenly single, she assumes the responsibility for supporting her son Eddie and coming to grips with what has just transpired. Lacking knowledge in taking financial care of the house and without job prospects Betty searches for an innovative way to feed her family. Overwhelmed, she fears she may have taken a drastic turn to fix her already broken world.

The Reader is an exceptionally well done and very sweet short . Every element of the piece assists in eliciting  the feelings of loss, hurt and vulnerability that this small girl so clearly conveys throughout. From the quiet minimalistic musical score to the poignant subtle dialogues the atmosphere created was unforgettable and moved the viewer greatly.The performances of the entire cast of four talented actors bring the realism of life and youth home in a powerful manner. Everything, right down to the color scheme of the movie are well crafted and chosen for conveying specific emotion at exacting points of the story.

The movie is good and I think Tiffany Amber is very beautiful . I liked the movie . Can anyone  explain me what’s going on? Well, Tiffany Amber is a story about two sisters whose lives have gone different ways but continue to care deeply for each other. The movie showcases the journey both of them go through while striving to maintain their bond with each other, in spite of various changes life throws at them. I think it also reflects upon relationships with family, as to how growing up in a different direction should not stand as a hurdle in growing together as individuals.

Please be aware that this film has nothing to do with the Radio City Music Hall ! As an archivist  who has researched the site for decades, it was disheartening to realize that the beautiful theatre held no correlation to this modern remake of our favorite classic. While other cities attempt to refurbish their renowned locations and preserve the history within, Hollywood opted to abandon such archival methods and create their own mythical history of the structure. Hollywood celebrated their digital fabrication of the beloved music hall but shied away from revitalizing its artistic origin story.

Very good "Precoder" starring Dick Barthelmess, which in a way, kind of reminded me of Hawks' "Only Angels Have Wings" (1939), in which Barthelmess also acted. This film was directed by masterful William Wellman, who was responsible for the landmark aviation Silent picture "Wings".Barthelmess plays a devil-may-care airplane pilot, who is a blamed for an aviation accident. Afterwards he meets and falls for pretty Sally Eilers, who participates as part of an Act in an itinerant Air Circus; but when Barthelmess' brother appears in scene, a triangular relationship ensues.

Gosh , I am learning pretty fast that sometimes when you see a film as a youngster and then again , a bit older things change. This could be because of changing tastes and expectations, as well as things happening to a person in the meantime. Even when the film content stays exactly the same the viewers’ reaction changes to a scene can also change. After all, every person is going through changes that, over time, change the way one processes images and music in films. Additionally, films grow and age, like us.

Susie Q is a great romantic prom Movie . Amy Jo Johnson ( Susie Q ) is a great Actress  and her acting really resonates in the movie. Not to forget the heart wrenching storyline between Susie Q and Joshua(Justin Timberlake). Susie’s humbled sweetness versus Joshua’s undeniable stoicism portray both how tender a young romantic relationship can be, and how two vastly different personalities can become part of each other in a rather light-hearted atmosphere. What is unique about this movie is that it strikes a very pleasant balance of never going too cliche with cheesy interactions, but instead opts for subtly cuteness within the same space.

I was expecting this movie to suck , but what I got was a pretty good slasher/gore film . Most  slasher films fail in the areas of characters and dialogue, but not this one. The actors were convincing and the dialogue was clever. What surprised me the most was how well developed the characters were. Each character was individual and could stand out from one another, and each had their own different journey that you watched from start to finish. You almost start to sympathize for the killers by the time it reaches the end. This movie defied the low expectations I had for it.

Almost four years after the Iraq war started and we're in a bigger hole than ever. That's right, so all those flag wavers who were so sure of the right and might of the American way are now chasing their tails, isn't that true? You bet it is. This movie said so from the beginning. It is kind of freaky how much the film,or should I say, filmmaker, knew what was coming. It is almost like going to a fortune teller and hearing what was going to happen in the future.

Finally a true horror movie. This is the first time in years that I had to cover my eyes. I am a horror buff and I recommend this movie but it is quite gory. I am not a big wrestling fan but Kane really pulled the whole monster thing off. I have to admit that I didn't want to see this movie, my 17 year old dragged me to it, but am very glad I did. During and after the movie I was looking over my shoulder. I have to agree with others about the whole remake horror movies enough is enough.

Although dated , this film is definitely worth a watch . I saw it about eight times as a teenager 

As an adult, this movie takes on an entirely new appreciation, particularly as its themes feel even more relatable now than ever. Even so, nostalgia helps shape the overall sentiment. Whenever I am feeling overwhelmed, I think of this classic. This always provides a helpful perspective. Though considered an older film, the relatability factor cannot be understated. Characters face the same dilemmas we do in modern-day times and watching the characters discover courage through tribulation continues to make a strong emotional connection with the audience.

I 'm not the biggest fan of westerns . My two personal favorites though are Unforgiven , and Tombstone . Unforgiven is special because of its dark, complex characters. Set in an aging cow-town and focusing on two legendary lawmen on the one hand, and some grizzled bandits and vengeful whores on the other hand, its story quickly builds up to a rewarding, raw finale. Tombstone, on the other hand, focuses less on psychology and philosophy, but more on giving its characters plenty of scenes and space to strut and tense out a cowboys-vs- outlaws climax.

Susie Q. is one of those rare, and sweet movies that give you a warm feeling. It's bittersweet, but wholesome, and it's characters are fun, and captivating. At first, I thought the movie would be the cliché cuddly movie that would bore me after five minutes, but was I wrong. It made me tear up at times, and it's plot was enticing, making me root for the good guys. I loved the movie, and still remember it today, 9 years later!!

wow ! i just have to say this show is super cool ! i fell in love with the show  instantly and can't get enough of it. It has such unique stories, characters, music and plots that keep me invested from the beginning. I'm already trying to figure out who will be next in the season and where they might go. The exciting part is you never really know what to expect which just makes it so enjoyable! Every episode feels like a movie and by the end you are invested in their journey. What makes the show extra special is how creative and thought-provoking it is.

I saw this movie back in 1954 on a double-bill with `` Valley of the Kings . '' These movies  left a lasting impression on me because I'd never seen anything like them. The iconic costuming and production designs stayed with me ever since and have continuously amazed me for over fifty years. The passion and conviction in the acting of some of the actors could give life to those ancient characters like no other movie ever could. I'd even still dream of grand Egyptian courtyards and long evenings of shabties talking to the mummy of a long-ago pharaoh!

Michelle , Anicée Alvina , was so nice , and I really fall in love with her . She died  because of the Coronavirus at the age of 70. It felt so surreal when the news of her passing away was first made known to me. Her peaceful disposition and genuine warmth really drew me to her; although, I only had a few moments with her, it made a lifetime of difference to me. There wasn’t anyone quite like her. All her life, Michelle strove to build relationships, pushing boundaries and making positive change.

It's interesting to watch how late 1950's society is depicted in this film. Men are lecherous, chain-smoking boozers with one thing on their minds (time hasn't changed men all that much, but "sexual harassment" has) & women are in the workplace only passing time until they find a husband & settle down. Some of the dialog is cringe-worthy but yet it's charming in an innocent, passé way. I love the opening credits that show a romantic, exciting view of Manhattan with Johnny Mathis singing "The Best Of Everything" on the soundtrack.

Great Movie! The sound track is awesome! Very relaxing sound. Elton was ahead of his own time even back in 1971. Lewis Gilbert did a magnificent job producing and directing this film! The movie was romantic and a breath of fresh air. The sound tracks written by Sir Elton complimented the movie to a T. Rex Morris does a great job with the tenor sax on the song "Honey Roll" and poem "I Meant To Do My Work Today" by Richard Le Gallienne was incredible! Kudos to everyone involved with this fantastic film!

Im a die hard Dads Army fan and nothing will ever change that . I got all the tapes ,  magazines , books and DVDS. I feel connected to this program . Watching old reruns never gets boring to me and brings a feeling of happiness each time. The chemistry between the characters, although caricatures, creates funny, unique and interesting situations and humor. I have the memorabilia carefully hung in the hall, mostly plates featuring characters’ signatures and messages. They’re something of a proud part of my decor, constantly drawing attention and admiration of guests who step into my living room.

Together with the even more underrated , The Sun Shines Bright, Wagon Master was one of Ford's favorite films. It is a western of exceptional beauty and narrative purity, well acted by members of Ford's 'stock company', including Jane Darwell, Alan Mowbray, Ward Bond,and Harry Carey, Jr.Like almost all of Ford's films,it is a meditation on freedom and community. It is also noteworthy for a much more positive portrayal of Indians than in most of Ford's movies. Ford, for all his faults, remains the supreme poet of American Democracy.

Having read all of the comments on this film I am still amazed at Fox's reluctance to release a full screen restored version in DVD. Yes, the history may be a bit inaccurate and it is certainly not as powerful as the book, BUT it was the 2nd film by Fox made in Real Cinemascope and the production values alone merit a restoration and distribution. I saw this film in second grade and it triggered my lifelong interest in all things Egyptian, culminating in my visiting Egypt 4 years ago! Amazing the power of film on a child's imagination, eh?

I saw this film on the same night I saw 6 other shorts . This one was leaps and bounds  above the others. I think the other movies must have dulled my expectations. When this particular film ended, I was at awe of its remarkable achievements. Even months later, I am still enchanted with the story-telling. It was undoubtedly the highlight of the night and from then on I was more and more inclined towards exploring new styles and forms of independent films. I take inspiration from the director for pushing me to challenge my art and to evolve, constantly questioning how things are conventionally done.

I have watched this show from the beginning, and I am a 45 year old man. To me, this is so much more that a show that appeals to women. This is the story of a family, possibly an unusual one, but a family none the less. It centers around a mother and daughter, Lorelei and Rory Gilmore, two bright, attractive, and in their own ways successful women. Lorelei makes her home in fictional Stars Hollow, CT, a small New England town with a sense of history, and a population of people that may be unusual, but acts as a dysfunctional family.

Had the pleasure to see this film at the Big Bear Film Festival where it won the Audience Award . This only added to my admiration for the movie. Since the festival, it has gone on to much bigger success, playing on dozens of different platforms across the world and receiving numerous awards. Reviews of the movie have been overwhelmingly positive and audiences everywhere seem to be taken with it, as it strikes an important chord of compassion and shared experience. After more than 10 years in development, I can only be glad that it found the success that it richly deserves.

Unfortunately, I've never seen the full version of this movie. I did see the 87-minute version twice, back in the 1950s. Even more floridly directed than is the norm with Julien Duvivier, this is a wonderfully out-of-the-ordinary piece, replete with sweeping tracking shots through, over and into Andrejew's magnificently atmospheric sets. Beautifully lit too by photographer André Thomas, Black Jack is nothing if not a connoisseur's delight. Reinforcing this imaginative visual style, is a script that allows a roster of our favorite actors, including Agnes Moorehead and Marcel Dalio, some brilliantly bizarre, full-blooded characterizations.

Maybe it 's just a personal affection for this screen version of the Mika Waltari novel , or a fondness  for Kirk Douglas in full sword- wielding swashbuckling action mode

but I tend to consider this 1956 version of The Apprenticeship of Duddy Kravitz one of the all-time great cinematic adaptations.The storyline follows Kravitz (Kirk Douglas)as a youth embarking on an arduous apprenticeship in pursuit of becoming a real estate tycoon and this imparts both funny and intense lessons of learning that resonate today. Watching Douglas cutting deals and striking business with alacrity provides one with understanding of drive and ambition on multiple levels.

This twisted comedy is well acted and directed. Very funny and the production quality is outstanding. It is easy to see why this short film has been accepted into so many festivals and won awards.Everyone can identify with Calvin having a bad day, bad week, bad life. Travis Davis plays the role superbly! Richard Moll as Tim brings darkness and foreboding that gives this film just the right twistedness. The old man adds to the humor of the story. And who wouldn't love the suicidal goldfish!This short will bring lots of laughs.

So we saw this on DVD at our apartment here in Paris. We're all here on an exchange program. We all laughed so hard cuz so much of what was going on in the movie happened to us! I mean yeah sure some of it was pretty clichéd but still true, know what I'm saying.I think I related more to the quiet guy (the Italian) than Xavier because I'm more of the observer in our group. Anyway, I wish I had a hot roommate like Cecile de France.

There 's a unique place in the pantheon of John Ford films for Wagonmaster , Sergeant Rutledge , and The  Sun Shines Bright . These classic John Ford films have consistently resonated with modern audiences and have demonstrated his growth as a filmmaker. All three contain Ford’s remarkable eye for capturing memorable shots as well as insightful dialog. Sergeant Rutledge was widely hailed as a breakthrough work and displayed his remarkable vision as he blended elements of the western with melodrama, mystery and ultimately an excellent story that celebrates the western legacy. Wagonmaster explores the road west and celebrates a master filmmaker’s masterpiece.

A train holding union soldiers is transporting $ 300,000 of gold , along with a banker Clayton , who 's  accompanied by bodyguards 

When they cross into Confederate land, the Confederate government made an ambush plan on the train. Armed guerillas put an oil wagon on the track and ignited it when the train arrived. During the chaos and shootout, Clayton manages to jump out of the wagon with some of the guards, leaving most of the gold in the chaos. The banker was followed for the gold by the Confederate government soldiers but he soon lost them in the dense forests nearby.

This game is very good for the n64. You can skate as Tony Hawk, Bob Burnquist, Steve Caballero, Kareem Campell, Eric Koston, Bucky Lasek, Rune Glifberg, Andrew Reynolds, Elissa Steamer, Jamie Thomas, Rodney Mullen, Chad Muska, and maybe some more skaters. The game doesn't have Mike V or Bam Margera. Dang! Well anyway, the gameplay is awesome. The level School II is a great level with so much to skate. In Career mode, you collect SKATE, get money, get high scores and other various things in 2 minutes.

This comment discusses "North and South Book I" dealing with 1842-1861 periodThe 19th century history of the USA is mostly identified by people with the Civil War (1861-1865). This is a reasonable opinion because that was Civil War which put the Union under the severe test; that was the Civil War which made Americans realize how precious it is to live in peace; finally, that was this period which at last brought the end to the shameful system of slavery. From the birth of motion pictures, there were people who adapted that time onto screen.

Gosh, I am learning pretty fast that sometimes when you see a film as a youngster and then again 20 years later you gain a different view -- primarily because in 20 years you learn more. For example, I had no idea who George Cukor was - how great of a director he was and how much of that made this film fly. All I can say is..I really liked this film for it touched on an area that paralleled my life: lifelong friendship between two women. Can that EVER exist?

MCBOING BOING is one of the cartoons that have stuck in my head over the years and finally decided to look into it as was pleasantly surprised and was also surprised on the people involved with the production. If I remember correctly we had to watch it on a UHF station and this meant using a converter in those days UHF not part of regular TV to tune in the local station to watch the cartoon a big deal in those days which made the show even more mysterious. I remember all the sound effects that Gerald used to talk. A great memory from 50+ years ago.

North and South is a miniseries from the "golden age" of television miniseries in the 1980s, which was a time for long, sweeping epics with high production values and lots of star cameos. It is, for the most part, excellent for what it is, although I personally prefer the less soap-opera like elements of the story and the overall sense of history.James Read and Patrick Swayze deliver excellent performances--especially Read, whose George Hazard serves as kind of an emotional anchor in the midst of the often melodramatic story.

First love. Teenage love. We all have experienced it even if it was not as sweet as the one the protagonists share. "Friends" could be considered an adaptation of the classic "The Blue Lagoon", originally from 1949, and its remakes from 1980 (the most popular one, with Brooke Shields) and 1999 (with a young Milla Jovovich). While "The Blue Lagoon" puts the two young lovers in a desert island, with no contact with civilization, "Friends" goes the opposite route and it is sure to ring much more true and be a more difficult movie with contemporary audiences.

Recently I saw this movie again ( after 25 years ) . In the original there is a scene in  which two men set out to escape by breaking through a barbed wire fence. As the scene opens, the men crawl through a mire of mud, the sounds of thunderclaps echoing across the backdrop as a storm breaks in the sky. It's dark, intimidating and you feel their trepidation as they travel through a small clearing that doesn't protect them from being seen from nearby search lights. Suddenly there’s a halt and an angry snarling voice of an anonymous voice over the microphone.

Others have commented on the somewhat strange video arrangements . I think they were trying to capture what you 'd  feel in the pit during one of their shows. The animation and colors have their own charm that hints at their signature post-rock energy. The graphics and imagery in their videos conveys this energy through their muted colors and powerful lyrical focus, whether that's doom and gloom or expressions of hope. Though, it also helps convey the harsh truths about life or speaks of strength when reality is flipped on its head. Regardless of one's views, their videos communicate strong sentiments, be it determined hope or unflinching despair.

honestly .. this show warms my heart , i watch it EVERYDAY on fox family and now that the new  episode just dropped i couldn’t be more happier . I know a lot of people have the same joy, which makes this show so special. It provides entertainment for the whole family no matter what your background or preference. Every single time a new episode premieres I can count on my entire household sharing lots of laughter. I just feel so connected to every single character and each of them bring such great joy to my home every week. It brings families together.

Surprising , witty , funny and totally engaging , the film grabs a little-known reality : that of the student  artists of India. The student artistes draw influences from Indian Classical Dance forms to mime the complexities of each era and human emotion, emerging onto the mainstream culture. Through sharp cinematic chops and the midas touch of deft artistic writing, the directors highlight student stories like never before.It tackles societal, emotional issues like arranged marriage, immigration and identity crises in a humorous yet not dismissive way, integrating Hindi songs and stylised action.

10 respected directors each shot a short film with operatic arias as the inspiration ( and music ) . I 

Each director had full creative reign on their films, leaving some variations among them, though the original Operatic Arias persisted throughout. There are documentaries depicting the works, celebrating the ingenuity and variations the directors manage to derive. The finished product manages to flow like one singular narrative, honoring and serving the intentions of all involved directors in the creative project. Among their contributions include interactions between vocals, environments, gestures and metaphors related to their vision.

I only gave this nine stars instead of ten because i really do n't approve of pornography all that much 

The focus of many of the movie's jokes are a little too close to the material and honestly, I find it kind of distasteful. Pornography has caused so much harm in society, it’s hard for me to whole-heartedly endorse it. Despite all of its fun moments, I think the potential harmful effects should also be considered. For that reason, this movie can't earn a perfect score from me, despite how much I might want to otherwise.

Just see it! It's a smart movie but too hard to understand the first time. See it more than once. Everything that is seen or heard on the screen is intentionally crafted to evoke a feeling, sensation or tone. The clarity of certain visuals and the crispness of certain sounds are deliberately contrasted with blurred images or pops, crackles, hisses and barely audible sounds. The structure is non-linear and cyclical. Motifs recur as time runs both clockwise and counterclockwise. Expectations regarding "plot" and character" are broken signaling a non-traditional use of film to tell a story that is both contemporary and as old as humanity.

My girlfriend and I saw this movie when it was originally released. The controversy that surrounded the original release (teen nudity, physical intimacy and unwed pregnancy) were subjects that never touched our view of the film. We were close to the same age as Paul and Michelle and were experiencing many of the same intense and confusing emotions. We were too young to get caught up in the simplistic (at times) acting and the corny (at times) emotional twists. This movie spoke to us in a way that an adult love story never could have.

A lot about USA The Movie can be summed up in its title . It draws parallels between the attitudes , celebrations and everyday habits of a people and that of a nation as a whole. USA The Movie goes a step further and explores some deeper messages, namely those of racism, poverty and tribalism that we sometimes shy away from when discussing America's contributions to the world. We begin to see how, beneath the greatness of American icons, institutions and popular culture, there exists the socio-economic divides, including wage gaps and marginalisation of certain cultures, particularly ethnic and racial ones.

then you will be a big fan of this movie . Its almost the same basic concept , a nice  new spin on the old story

The plot thickens as you watch, gripping you more with each turn. The development of each character brings its own drama that really fuels the story. Add to that stunning visuals and original music, this film easily stands alone as a classic and of course any fan of this original concept must take in this new movie and the story. With beautiful performances by its stellar cast, this movie will quickly rise to iconic levels and its memories will last a lifetime.

Two Hands is a highly enjoyable Aussie crime caper , which ultimately succeeds by the way the film easily combines  strong humour with plenty of grit and grit violence

This grit and violence, when required, keeps the tension at bay, not least in some action sequences, but at all other times the fun elements from comedy to wit drives the narrative brilliantly. While an injection of hard criminal cruelty pops up at various points in the movie, two hands focuses mostly on affably haphazard life for two petty conmen which go beyond routine soot breaking activity.

In December 1945 a train leaves the central station of Stockholm for Berlin . There are n't much left when  it comes to family to say goodbye at the departure

All the war horrors have left a hollow gap for so many of them in Stockholm, even for the families whose family members had come home from the war. Most of the remaining war veterans depart to visit friends and family that have long lost each other's contact. But some also depart for darker destinations; prisons and trails, fear prevailing in every car.

I saw this film on the same night I saw 6 other shorts. This one was leaps and bounds ahead of the others in terms of quality of acting, directing, filming and originality of story. It comes together with a professionalism often lacking in short films.This is a great short film for the following reasons: 1. Amazing performances. The 2 actresses are both compelling and believable instantly. Their chemistry is palpable; the depth of their relationship is conveyed, even though the film is 10 mins long. The acting and directing are very powerful.2. Beautifully shot.

I got to watch this movie in my french class as part of lets say `` french culture '' . The movie we watched was quite eye-opening and gave me a new appreciation for French cinema and how much work it takes to create a great story like this. I even got to stay after class to ask the teacher more questions about what we had seen and her explanations further helped to further my understanding. Overall, it was a great experience and has certainly helped with the language and making sense of the cultural differences in a more comprehensible way.

Onstage John Osborne's adaptation of "Picture of Dorian Gray" is a fine tribute to Oscar Wilde's talents as both novelist and playwright.On screen with some editing it becomes a bit sloppy due to the cutting of 3 crucial scenes from the play (one being an important scene between Basil and Henry showing that time has passed. )The acting however is brilliant. Sir john Gielgud return's to his Wilde roots as lord Henry,and although about a decade too old for the role,he totally becomes the enigmatic,life loving cad and cynic that Wilde brought to life so meticulously in his novella.

Obsessed ! ! ! ! ! I have every season of Gilmore Girls and I think the reason I love  it is because of Lorelai and Rory's relationship. Whenever I am feeling down or upset, Lorelai and Rory's complicated, funny, yet deep mother-daughter relationship is what pulls me out. As their storyline advances with every episode and new drama ensues, the beauty of the relationship unfolds further with the display of strong connections and vulnerabilities. Despite their conflictual conversations and fights, ultimately, you get the sense that they always come to a resolution of love and trust between the two of them.

One of the many backwoods horror's that came out in the early eightes and fortunately this is one of the better ones. Yes it has a cheesy plot but I was pleasantly surprised at this film, because I thought it was really good and really entertaining, although the killer could have been made a bit more scarier he just looked like a fat slob.First of all, we have the local sheriff or whatever the hell he is, who warns them not to go to those mountains as they are very dangerous. But when the teens arrive, it doesn't seem very dangerous at all, well according to me anyway.

Just Before Dawn is one of those really good slashers that send chills down your spine every time you watch . It follows a group of friends hiking through a remote National Forest when strange occurrences start happening -one being attacked by an unseen presence in the woods. They soon learn the horrible truth about why their lives are in danger. As more corpses are discovered in the vicinity, their dread deepens. All attempts at escape come to nought and their situation gets even worse. With nobody to turn to and little ammunition left, the friends are in for a harrowing fight for their lives.

Don't watch this movie expecting the Jane Austen wit, crisp dialog or clever social commentary. This time around, the premise of Northanger Abbey has been updated in a very sensual way! In this version,Catherine's erotic daydreams are not just silly fantasies, but a connection to the world of adult sexuality she is just peeking into with her daylight adventures. By day she is very prim and demure, and her swain Henry treats her with the utmost courtesy. But as her own sexual nature awakens, her daydreams shift every so subtly from mild to steamy to lurid!

Great period piece that shows how attitudes have changed in 40 years. Great production design, appealing stars, great lines ("Miss Bender, I don't care if you beat it out on a native drum! ", says Joan Crawford's Amanda Farrow to Hope Lange when Lange incredulously asks how she is expected to read a summarize a large amount of manuscripts in a very short time). If you've seen this movie panned and scanned on TV and not in the letterboxed version on pay-TV or AMC (American Movie Classics) you haven't really seen it.

I first saw this movie on TV back in 1959 when I was eight years old . I knew nothing  about film but when I saw this movie I was awe-inspired by the magical use of color and light. My aunt, who lived nearby, took me to the theatre to see this movie for the second time. It was a completely different experience, made all the more real because it was much bigger, vibrant and intense on the big screen. This first theater experience profoundly impacted my opinion on movies and served as an invaluable learning experience on film.

I'm not usually into dark/psychological thriller type things. However, SEIZING ME is really an amazing piece of work. The story, acting, filming, psychological themes, erotic quality and spiritual understanding are all really quite complex and compelling. Rose plays the complexities and shifts of a psychologically disturbed woman really quite accurately. My partner was particularly impressed with the sophisticated way the power exchange issues were handled. It was so intense for us to watch that we found ourselves leaving it three quarters through to "get tea" and I felt compelled to have a shower.

This was such a great series for Black folks at the time . We loved it so much . It  was on par with other shows from different cultures in production and story line

Black folks finally had representation in entertainment with a series created just for us. This show offered stories from a different perspective, conveying cultural events and scenarios in a way that had been missing in the mainstream. While other minority groups were experiencing similar opportunities for better representation in television, for African American’s, it was still rare to be so accurately represented.

Although dated, this film is definitely worth a watch. I saw it about eight times as a teenager when it opened and it changed my life...I just HAD to live in New York. It has great opening shots of the Manhattan skyline with Johnny Mathis crooning "Romance is still...the best of everything..." that rival those of West Side Story. There is a rather stilted performance by the world's REAL first Supermodel, Suzy Parker (sorry about that, Janice D.), but it's great eye-candy!

Renee Zellweger is Betty, a Kansas waitress who wants to be a nurse, who is infatuated with a soap opera actor (Greg Kinnear), and who is married to Del, a cheating, stupid male chauvinist who's trying to sell some stolen drugs. Unfortunately for him, he gets brutally, bloodily murdered instead, while Betty secretly watches. It leaves her unhinged, believing that Kinnear is really the character he plays, Dr. David Ravell, and that she is his RN ex-fiancée. She heads for LA to find her lost love, not knowing the stolen drugs are in her trunk.

Sure , it has its pretentious moments , it plays like art-house , live-action Fantasia , but it also has  plenty of old fashioned Disney magic too. The whimsical set pieces such as in the sea voyage intercut between spirited puppet and ocean life hijinx speaks directly to our shared feelings of surprise and pleasure. This great fantasy keeps viewer mesmerized while always capturing and honing in the core Disney values; hope and happiness; tempered with melancholy; explored through breathtaking visuals.This live-action film gives even long-time fans something unique and special, carrying an undeniable delight of creativity with each lush shot that had fans speechless throughout theaters around the world.

The most beautiful film. If one is looking for serious depth, meaning and excellent performance then you have to get to watch this movie. excellent performances by the whole cast. Even more beautiful than A Beautiful Mind itself. Simply awesome!! I wish this movie entered the Oscars. I cried through the whole movie for the schizophrenic character. ..The most beautiful film. If one is looking for serious depth, meaning and excellent performance then you have to get to watch this movie. excellent performances by the whole cast. Even more beautiful than A Beautiful Mind itself.

This is a very well done film showing the life of international students during their "Erasmus year" in Barcelona which by the way is one of the most beautiful towns in Europe and is an ideal location. The idea itself with all the different languages is great and gives the film an original atmosphere. There are some clichés about the countries but most of them are true! The characters could not better represent their different countries.Having experienced "Erasmus" on myself during my exchang semester in Italy I can say that is movie is incredibly authentic.

I could n't believe that the Adult Swim guys came up with this character . I laughed for days just  by hearing his catch phrase:

After every episode I just kept replaying it in my head and thinking how ingenious it was to come up with the show, the character and all of the witticisms and situations they found him in. His words were undeniably comedic gold and to see him executed was a breath of fresh air and sure to lift anyone's spirits no matter how bad the day may be. Even long after the series is gone, he's definitely a character I can fondly remember for days to come.

Enjoyable film that gives you romance , women-on-the-verge psychodrama , work place sexual harassment , adultery , and fashion . The film offers everything in order to paint a vivid story that you can't ignore. With its powerful writing, musical scores and breathtaking visuals, it encapsulates you in a thrilling ride that offers an enlightening journey in every aspect of life. Be it politics, sisterhood, working out our beliefs or complications in adult life, the characters never miss a step or do things simply out of the movie formula, which in itself makes for an enjoyable watch.

Rabbit Seasoning is one of three cartoons that feature Bugs Bunny/Daffy Duck/Elmer Fudd in a war of words and wits about whether it's rabbit season or duck season. Love Bugs and Daffy stirring up "pronoun trouble" with Daffy always the victim of Elmer's shotgun resulting with his beak always getting dismembered. Then there's the rabbit's cross-dressing that always gets Elmer in his love struck mode. Chuck Jones and Michael Maltese are always favorites of mine in the writer-director team category because of these hilarious hunting trilogy cartoons I've laughed at since I was a kid.

When I saw the preview for this movie , I figured to myself , `` here 's another dumb TV  movie ''. Little did I know, as soon as I sat down to watch it, I'd find myself at the edge of my seat until the credits began to roll. It was a thrilling drama which far exceeded my expectations, featuring a great performance from the lead actor. By the end I was surprised that I had become emotionally involved, simply because I had been certain it was going to be something of less quality.

`` Please , do n't kill me ! I 'm just an actor ! '' `` Can you play dead ? Yes! I'm a trained actor and can play dead! Please just let me live and I promise to comply with any other requests. I understand why you want to take matters into your own hands but I'm sure there are better ways to address the problem. Let me help, don't just discard me. I may not seem valuable but I can add something meaningful to the table. Give me a chance and let's work together to resolve the situation!

This film had me spellbound this evening. Thanks to Fox Movie Classics for showing it uninterrupted. John Voight, this cast of little known black actresses and most of all, the children, made this a worthy way to spend a Sunday evening. How wonderful to see the early work of this seasoned actor, as well as Paul Winfield's excellent portrayal of Mad Billy. I can't see why anyone would say that Hume Cronyn is miscast in the role as superintendent. Who would they have chosen? The shrill character actor, Charles Lane?

I actually though that Black Snake Moan was great movie which takes place in the south . The story follows  two broken characters ,  Rae a sexually active but emotionally unconnected woman and Lazarus a struggling musiciian dealing with deep personal pain. The two eventually cross paths, leading to a series of shocking events, strong dialogues and soulful blues soundtrack. Though largely dominated by men , its compelling narrative that is supported by its visual look. Critics lauded this thought provoking drama. Having vivid cultural flavor of region coupled with colorful southern dialect created memorable audio track for movie.

Neil LaBute takes a dramatic turn from his first two films , In The Company of Men & Your Friends  and Neighbours

The surprise success of his initial movies cemented Neil LaBute's standing as one of modern cinema's premier talent, taking over his characteristic ability to present dark subjects within believable, subtle parameters. While continuing to refine his delicately formed talent as his third film, “Nurse Betty,” reveals the consistent fine tuning to even greater strength, including warmth to greater story relevance. Thereafter, further fine-tuning was demonstrated throughout several film series such as The Shape of Things and Lakeview Terrace.

Hands down , the best drama/comedy show on television . A cleverly written show about a young mother and her  journey towards maturity . Lorelai Gilmore’s witty comebacks and sharp yet kind nature draws you in to each episode of the Gilmore Girls. Her story of conquering love and professional growth, together with her light hearted interaction with the world around her, had us laugh through all the heartbreak she felt and guided us all along her journey to be better each day. At its heart, this show is simply a loving tribute to motherhood, in all of its flawed and amazing entirety, no matter the age of its heroine.

`` Americans Next Top Model '' is the best reality show ! I was entertained 99.9 percent of the time  ! The best part of the show for me was watching all of the models struggle and compete for the top spot. It was inspiring to see people determined to break out of their shells and make it on their own. The elimination process also had its highlights. Seeing someone walk away from the competition still with their head held high despite the sadness of rejection was simply heartbreaking. Overall, watching the progress of each of the contestants was rewarding.

The show is GREAT. No words to describe it. Wonderful music. Incredible dance. The editors couldn't spoil it, not because they were not *that*bad*, but because the show is really *that*good*.The editors are compulsive cutters, you can't see a scene without a cut for more than 15 secs. It's OK to show various angles, but those guys were working with multiple cameras for the first time in their lives, and they will remind you of how many cameras they have every five seconds on average...

Inarguably one of the most interesting filmmakers of the last 50 years , Werner Herzog has been pushing the boundaries  of storytelling. With every one of his film productions, Herzog demonstrated that creativity and innovation weren't limited to any set rulebook. Be it shooting a feature on a moose-based improvised story, gathering historical knowledge in a searing deathbed monologue, or ultimately entertaining in virtual reality with ancient shipwreck stories-he has managed to stretch the framework for filmmakers for the following generation to further unravel.His philosophy challenges creators to break the mundane film culture mold, to dare in risk-taking, and to question traditions.

Very good `` Precoder '' starring Dick Barthelmess , which in a way , kind of reminded me of Hawks 's film Sergeant York , wherein he is continually wanting to get some rust off his guard he fought his battle , except instead he wants to know how to actually jump the dice , dance his foot in the meadow with the player getting more while avoiding an the draw of the house. The first game of Precoder showed it could definitely become an entertaining attraction. For the more dedicated player it brought in competitive qualities as seen in games like Poker, such as recognizing 'tells' of deception.

Unlike some of the former commentators , I was ( and am ) an avid fan of the Carpenters . From an early age, the music of Carpenters really spoke to me. The lyrics were both heartfelt and meaningful. I find the mix of pop, rock, soul and country very infectious and endlessly inspiring. With Richard’s hauntingly sweet yet solid melodies and Karen’s delicate and passionate vocals, the duo offered a captivating listen. Their tunes ranged from moody, minor chord meditations to soulful major scale folk gems and anthemic keyboard anthems.

This small John Ford western with no 'stars ' but a cast of character actors is one of his masterpieces , offering many beautiful shots. One particular scene in which Alan Marshal stands alone looking at a herd of antelope across a stream stands out as particularly iconic, taking in the moment to behold the grandeur of nature in spite of its moral brutality. The scenes in which he gets his revenge offer the veneer of satisfaction the genre demands but hinting that perhaps such nihilism can never be morally or spiritually justified. Ford brings in some great flourishes, turning something typically cut and dry into a well balanced, superbly edited ride.

I must say it was a let down . Overall its great to see the way Aparna Sen has handled  the direction of the movie

In spite of this let down, the acting by the lead actors, Konkana Sen and Jisshu Sengupta was excellent, given their off-screen chemistry as well. Moreover, Sengupta added intensity to the characters with his emotions- some scenes made you well-up. Cinematographer Sachikant Sadgopal's focus on colorful bengali dresses and ambience was eye-catching and his visuals were vivid and well balanced. His insight into nuances of love and life was accurately conveyed in Aparna's motion picture.

Successful films on metaphysical subjects are rare, but Fata Morgana is a good case. You can chalk up the large subject to the ambitions of youth, but Herzog does an amazingly good job. The movie's point is to show human beings, and even the world, from a non-human point of view.The movie is in three parts: Creation, Paradise, and The Golden Age. The imagery of each is in counterpoint to the voice-over. Although the text of `The Creation' (from the Popol Vuh, a Mayan myth) refers to the primordial wasteland, the scene goes no further in illustrating the myth.

Robin Hood ; Men in Tights is worth watching , I recently watched it because I 've just become a  Robin Hood fan. It's hilarious. The plot follows Robin and his band of merry men (featuring outstanding actors such as Kevin Kline, Dave Chappelle and Nathan Lane), who use comical tactics to stay one step ahead of the relentless Sheriff of Nottingham. I particularly enjoyed the cast’s irreverent takes on familiar plot elements and characters such as Prince John, Friar Tuck and Maid Marian. Not to mention some of the goofy dance moves from the team!

I liked this a lot . The camera angles are cool , it 's not all jumpy like a Blair  Witch 

The music was on-point with the eerie moments, especially the violin solo when something spooky happened. The scenery was very well-suited to the movie, since the background setting looked and sounded right to enhance the already extraordinary effects. To top it off, the actors' performances was brilliant and you could feel their terror through the camera. It has been quite a ride! My favourite part of the whole movie was probably the final scene as all the strands came together.

I only gave this nine stars instead of ten because i really don't approve of pornography all that much. pornography has a useful purpose in society(can't say i can always think of one)but it probably does.personal viewpoints set aside, i really thought this film was pretty funny. i didn't buy this movie because it was pornography, i bought it because i am one of those 'Alice' obsessives who will watch anything about 'Alice in Wonderland'. i own just about every version there is on DVD so it was an obvious choice to complete my DVD collection with this.

This epic brings together a superbly-gifted cast and crew , a narrative depth superior to most novels , wonderful music  and profound lyrics. Combining captivating camera shots and magnetic musical moments, this musical displays fantastic feat of filmmaking and highlights true-to-life values with powerful messages that give goosebumps to any viewer. It provides lasting inspiration to discover adventure and serves as an immense visual display to how relationships shape and work within today's day and age. Heart-racing and eye-opening, this epic ushers you along with characters in unpredictable places to grapple with values not much discussed today, ranging from notions of loyalty to concepts of transformation.

In one of the many Bugs Bunny-Daffy Duck cartoons , Elmer Fudd is out hunting , and Daffy tries to  duck into an opening

Daffy hopes Elmer will pass him by, and runs right in, slamming the door. Elmer hears the sound and runs toward it, giving a big yawp to try and force open the door. But his voice echoes inside, forcing the hapless duck to keep shuffling from room to room in a desperate bid for safety. Elmer desperately pleads for help from a sheep he saw and rounds the corner--right into the barrel of his gun.

The first time I saw "Alice in Wonderland  an X-rated Musical Comedy", was in the early '80 in a Movie-Theater in N.Y. City with some friends. I remember we actually enjoyed it very much, although we were left wondering why all the "goodies" were covered by in various forms shaped colored patches and why the movie was suddenly jumping from one scene to the next one, leaving us guessing...what we just missed. Obviously it was the soft-core edited (chopped) version, which left me with the desire to watch it again soon, but in its original integral version.

Brian ( Wesley Eure ) works for a security firm owned by Mr. Norton ( Conrad Bain ) . The  staff of Mr. Norton also includes Janet ( Juliet Potter ), an enthusiastic girl in charge of customer relations

Brian's primary responsibility is ensuring the safety and security of their clients. As part of his job, he has to liaise with local law enforcement for effective crisis management. With Janet, Brian spends much of his free time further training their personnel and further implementing innovative techniques that help keep their clients' assets safe.

One of the best! As being a fan of the civil war, I was very pleased with the first installment of the North and South trilogy. Patrick Swayze gives and extraordinary performance, as well as James Reed and Leslie Ann Down. In watching this fabulous story unfold into a time never forgotten, the subjects of love, passion, grief, shame, harmony, and cruelty come to life. I was first introduced to this series when I was in the eighth grade. Being a young boy, you would think that I wouldn't have been interested in this civil war soap.

I 'm astounded and dismayed by the number of reviewers on this site who did not get the point of  the film at all. My own opinion of this film, unlike other reviews, has been affirmed and validated in a time when reviews matter a great deal. We all form our own judgments based on what we consume and observe, but after experiencing this movie, I know I was right in my opinion that this film carries a deep and meaningful message that resonates deeply. It delves into much-discussed social issues, subtly holding a mirror up to society’s conscience.

In my opinion dads army is thee best British sitcom of all time. I believe that if you just watch one episode of the show you cannot judge in completely on that one episode, (this include the movie) You must at least watch a series of this show, get inside the characters, become familiar with there surroundings and the situations which they are in. When you become familiar with the show then it will start appealing to you. Now the movie has a few changes to the series which is slightly disappointing, but it still works.

I thought I was wasting my precious 50 bucks going to watch this movie. But at the earnest request of my friend who is an ardent fan of Aparna Sen, I decided to turn up for the movie. Going at this cheap theater really bothered me, cos I had seen King Kong for 50 bucks at one of the best theatres in town. Anywasy the movie starts of and surprisingly I wasn't complaining. A great story and some really wonderful wonderful acting on Shabana Azmi and Konkona Sen Sharma's part. Shabana Azmi a divorcée who has dedicated her life to the well being of her mother and step sister.

I came across this movie in an Australian hotel room at 3 am . My brother and I were channel  surfing

My brother suddenly stumbled on the movie, so intrigued I had to see it for myself. After about a few minutes into it, I had an idea to watch the rest of it. To my surprise the movie completely had different plot to the original expectation I had about it. It was intense with lots of different events to keep my eyes peeled for. Before I realized it had passed 1 hour and a half, as we kept engaging in conversation as we discovered one key points.

A classic late 50 's film . The superannuated headliners ( Joan Crawford and Louis Jordan ) are not at  their top playing in Queen Bee but do attempt to deliver solid performances even within the project 's typical run -of-the-mill repertoire. The duo of leading actors prove enough to glue the overall, middling thriller and keep the story moving along in a mediocre, yet passable matter. Sure, they're backed by few sardonically angled glances and gleefully cheap red herrings and very stock shenanigans, but their job is made good here despite any imbalances in cohesiveness and sense.

I watched this movie at the first showing available in my area , and it was quite clear that most  viewers were only in attendance for the star, Zac Efron. Although I understand the movie had something to do with a bear and camping, I wasn't overly excited about the film because of Zac. Once the film began however, I found the film much more than what it looked to be. There were deep conversations about companionship, heartwarming moments of hope, and genuinely funny jokes. What appeared to be an awkward storyline with over-exaggerated laughs instead ended up being a surprisingly deep film.

I have been watching King of Queens from the beginning , and have felt it is overlooked at the award  shows. King of Queens remains a staple of American culture that has kept up with the changes in time and shown us laughter no matter what the situation. The subtle subtleties, the socially astute commentary, the modern solutions-turned-humorous solutions have all pushed the boundaries of comedy since it's premier 20 years ago. Despite this, we all know the biggest television award shows seemingly missed their opportunities for rewards and nominations for King of Queens’ star and series performances.

The hurried approach that Lewis Seiler takes with King of the Underworld establishes a deeper plot , while still maintaining  character development and advances the main plot

As King of the Underworld rises to a whole new level, Seiler’s screenplay consistently depicts emotion, backstories and character driven twists in order to add color and more intriguing angles to the film. Through careful story boarding and an awareness of structure, we’re offered with riveting montages and exploration of human reactions which develops the characters at an interesting yet steady rate, eventually culminate into a resolved film.

'The Cell ' is a journey into the mind of a serial killer and I mean this literally . The  killer can barely think for himself but he manages to communicate with himself and some of the monsters he has created 

He journeys around trying to solve the mystery of why he committed the crimes, but discovers a web of secrets that ties his whole identity in a spiral of chaotic, creative and bizarre scenarios. He tries desperately to make sense of it, slowly unlocking himself piece by piece and all that surrounds him, no matter how painful or terrifying the truth may be.

The "Hunting Trilogy" of Rabbit Fire (1951), Rabbit Seasoning (1952), and Duck! Rabbit! Duck! (1953) should be considered the comedic high water mark of the Chuck Jones-Michael Maltese collaboration. While they are seldom mentioned in lists of the "greatest" or "most important" cartoons in the history of animation, they are certainly THE FUNNIEST cartoons I've ever seen. Michael Maltese never got the credit that directors like Jones, Freleng or Avery got, but it's his dialogue and situations that make Warner Bros. cartoons, and these three in particular, some of the FUNNIEST ever made.

Surprising, witty, funny and totally engaging, the film grabs a little-known reality: that of the student that goes studying in an Erasmus program. The beginning is great, as the story kicks off, of course it has a few lulls on the midsection, and the story drifts sometimes away from the main character, but the viewer won't bother - the movie is young, fresh, and light-hearted, even though I don't agree with the notion that when you do Erasmus and you come back you no longer make part of that universe. But that's just me.

The entire series, not just The Blue Planet, is nothing short of amazing. The best nature series we have ever seen. The episode on the deep is like traveling to outer space! We have watched this with our 10 and 7 year old boys and all four of us have not been able to pull away. We read a negative comment on this and could not believe it. There is so much new information that we never learned in school. Its also the best view we have seen from any television or movie into the delicate balance of our earth's eco-system.

Forget about Donnie Darko . I open with this because it seems that a good portion of the reviews I  read failed to differentiate

Between Donnie Darko and Richard Kelly's body of work as a whole. His efforts throughout the years demonstrate his real gift for fleshing out his quirky, high-concept ideas, although sometimes he may push too far and take chances that aren't well-received by critics. In more recent years Kelly has increasingly changed his tone; his projects tend to be either mutedly psychological dramas, while still touching on his own fears and personal biases, or somewhat classic horror stories rooted in paranoia and unknown.

Kane is a killer named Jacob Goodnight , he lives in this burned down old hotel , where eight teen  girls have disappeared

The police came looking for him but they could never catch Jacob, they couldn't believe how easily he moved throughout the darkness, around all the ancient floors of the dilapidated building. It became apparent that he was extremely cunning and enjoyed his secrets of his hiding places in and out of the hotel, like a black ghost amidst the decaying landscape. He soon earned his sinister nickname ‘The Collector’, but why is he abducting innocent teens?

Well its a great work by Aparnaji and some where people like this makes us believe that there is a lot more concepts till now which has to be expressed and the film is a great media to do that. Well all great actors together hence nothing to say about acting or directing but the film gave us a great message through out. It has nicely predicted the conditioning of human minds with that of the patient. We all believe that what we believe is true with our own point of view and we want to solve all the problem accordingly.Hence from the professor to the maid servant all tried their own ways.

Brilliant film ! I am sorry to say that it resembles to me a bit like Pulp F. but thats  

Despite the similarities, I found that this film was still quite entertaining. The characters were likable and I felt emotionally connected to their struggles. There were so many intricate story details that came together so perfectly. Even the suspenseful moments were enthralling. The quality of this film definitely met my expectations, and surpassed it in certain moments. If you're in the mood for an enthralling plot, don't miss this brilliant movie. It will surely keep you entertained from the beginning to the very end.

I have just seen a very original film that I would recommend to everyone including `the young & the restless.' However, I guess some of the profanity, violence, and sexual innuendo in the movie are not suitable for `all your children.' Anyways before the sand fills up the hourglass, let me tell you the name of the film: `Nurse Betty.' Renee Zellweger stars as Betty. She is a Kansas waitress who falls under a trance, and thinks she is a real life character of her favorite soap opera.

Alright so this episode makes fun of Al Gore. I'm sure it pisses a few liberals off. The thing is South Park makes fun of everybody, much like the Simpsons did. If you get offended that a politician you like is made fun of then maybe you need a better sense of humor and are taking the show too seriously. With that being said this episode is hilarious and one of the best. Al Gores portrayal is hilarious, Cartman's scheme goes terribly wrong and the results will have you rolling on the floor laughing.

I bought this movie because of Raquel Welch . She was gorgeous in this film as she played the role  of Wendy. I found her performance to be delightful, lively and engaging. Every time she was on the screen she added so much charm and class. I particularly appreciated the natural chemistry between Raquel and her co-stars in the movie. It made her the ideal leading lady to watch in this adventurous comedy-drama. The wardrobe of Welch in the movie further added to its mystique, giving off an ultra-glamorous flair that complemented her lively and comical style of performance.

With all the dreck out there , this is a gentle movie about young love . Yes , it 's  predictable in the grand scheme of romantic comedies but it succeeds because it brings the story to life in such a unique way. The interactions between the two lead actors feels genuine , yet vibrant and funny. From the expression of bewildered skepticism to the simple cuddle, they successfully deliver a brilliant story that provokes love, hope, and loss without excessive heart-pulling attempts. There's just something special about the bond of this story, which undeniably engages with your heart strings until the very end.

In a time of bad, if not plain awful, comedies, King of Queens is more than just a breath of fresh air, it's a complete oxygen tank! It is in my opinion one of the 5 best comedy shows of all times. Nothing has been this good since Married with Children. Kevin James and Jerry Stiller are comic geniuses! And believe me, it takes a lot to make me label someone as comic genius. These guys truly understand what is funny. I could watch ten episodes of Seinfeld and wouldn't get half the laughs from seeing KOQ just once.

Every time I watch this show I just want to turn it off and curse the makers for wasting my  time

That's because it isn't stimulating or thrilling to watch, the actors are flat, there are gaping holes in the plotline that they thought they covered, and the writing makes the show nearly unwatchable. Despite this, I end up giving it one more try before I stop completely. I think part of it is wanting it to get better, hoping against hope that this will be the time that the show hits the reset button and comes out with something spectacular that brings a whole new feel to it.

I haven't seen a film in a long time that moved me and gripped me in such a way; that I couldn't take my eyes off the screen. I was busting for the loo; and I didn't even want to pause it because I was drawn right in. Emotive; powerful; very moving; horrific and heart-breaking. It gives you an amazing insight to South Africa; their struggles and their lives. The acting by the leads were mind-blowing and the script was incredible. Despite the terrible events that unfold in this film and how horrific the story is; I was captivated.

My girlfriend and I saw this movie when it was originally released . The controversy that surrounded the original release  really drew a lot of people to it, both interested and appalled. I found myself conflicted - even though I disagreed with the message, I had to admire the conviction of its delivery. While watching the film, I had to ponder if these would-be outcasts held power I was unaware of and had chosen the strength of collective spirit over isolation. Although our experience felt daring in the theatre that day, the movie ended up holding its power and continued to make a significant cultural impression in the decades that followed.

People need to give this show a chance . The people who write bad reviews ( there are very few  , to begin with ) may be missing out on a really interesting show 

The acting in the show is so incredible and powerful that you can't help but feel your heart beating with them during the episodes. Everyone has their own idea of what is a great show and everyone should give the show a chance and see for themselves, whether or not it captures their hearts and minds. Those who like what they see will get many rewarding and captivating episodes of compelling characters and evolving storylines.

***SPOILERS*** ***SPOILERS*** THE CELL / (2000) **** (out of four)"Do you believe there is a part of yourself, deep inside in your mind, with things you don't want other people to see? During a session when I'm inside, I get to see those things." --Catherine DeaneAnd so do we. One of the most visually stimulating films of the year, "The Cell" is a love/hate movie-either you love it or you hate it.
